She first had contact with aviculture in Maxixe – Province of Inhambane, in her aunt’s house. She was impressed by the way her aunts’ income was able to help her family. From the allowance she received from the husband, Isabel set aside money to start making blocks which served to build a chicken coup. With the installations ready she decided to request a loan to start her business. Isabel’s first experience with micro-credit was really good, she was able to repay her loan, and generate extra income for the family. With the loan of 10,000.00MTN, Isabel will expand the number of chickens from 100 to 200, aiming to expand not only the quantity but also the quality of her product. With the profits she will assist her husband in generating enough income to sustain her family, school her children, and save a small amount for a rainy day. Isabel’s business will also brings her chicken at an accessible price to her community. In the future she hopes to increase the size of her installations.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro Chamissava - Catembe Cliente: Isabel salomão Chemane Actividade: Avicultura Valor empréstimo: 10.000,00MT (400.00US$) Aplicação do empréstimo: Compra de pintos e rações Início: 12/04/2007 Fim: 31/03/2008 Isabel, tem 31 anos, nasceu na Cidade de Maputo, cresceu e viveu com a mãe e irmãos no Bairro do Aeroporto onde estudou e concluiu a 6ª classe. Anos mais tarde foi viver com a tia em Manjacaze – Província de Gaza, onde dedicava-se a agricultura como forma de ajudar a família. Em 1993 casou-se maritalmente e teve 4 filhos. Teve o primeiro contacto com o ramo da avicultura em Maxixe – Província de Inhambane em casa de sua tia, tendo ficado impressionada pela forma como a tia contribuía para aumentar a renda na família. Da mesada que o marido dava, repartiu algum dinheiro para iniciar a fabricar blocos que serviram mais tarde para construir a capoeira. Com as instalações prontas decide pedir empréstimo para iniciar com actividade e a experiência foi positiva, póis conseguiu pagar as letras satisfatoriamente e teve uma margem suficiente para a cobertura das despesas incluindo o sustento familiar. Com o crédito de 10.000,00MTN pretende aumentar o número de pintos de 100 para 200 e conseguir colocar seu produto com maior quantidade e qualidade apreciável. Com os lucros do negócio consegue ajudar o marido na renda familiar, pôr as crianças a estudar, poupar algum dinheiro para os momentos de crise. Também coloca perto da comunidade a proteína animal que é vital para a saúde. A perspectiva futura é aumentar o tamanho das instalações.

loans.use: To produce chickens

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Lelia

texts.en:
Lelia has a small business selling drinks, sweets, and dairy products from her home. She began doing this 10 years ago with her small amount of savings. It took a lot of effort since the father of her three children abandoned the family. She had to find a way to earn some money to take care of her family. Lelia not only sells these products, but in the afternoon she also sells empanadas. She is open from 6am to 10pm. Lelia is asking for a loan to improve her business because right now, with school in session, demand has increased. With the loan, she plans to invest in more goods so that she can meet the needs of her clients. Lelia is very young and a hard worker. She is 37 and has put a lot of effort into raising her 3 children. She knows and is completely confident that with the loan she will be able to earn more so that she can continue to provide her family with a good life and home.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Lelia tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de colas, confites y productos lácteos ubicado en su casa desde hace 10 años se inicio con un pequeño capital ahorrados con esfuerzo ya que el padre de sus tres hijos la abandono por lo que tuvo que ver la manera de generar ingresos para su familia . Lelia no solo vende eso sino que adicionalmente por las tardes vende empanadas, su atención al publico lo hace desde las 6AM a 22PM.

Lelia solicita el préstamo para incrementar su negocio ya que estamos en época escolar y su demanda a aumentado. Con el préstamo ella invertirá en más mercadería y así poder cumplir con las necesidades de sus clientes.

Lelia es una persona joven y trabajadora tiene 37 años y se ha esforzado mucho para la crianza de sus 3 hijos. Ella sabe y tiene la plena confianza que con el préstamo generara mayores ingresos y podrá seguir dando mejor bienestar a su familia y hogar.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her store

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy has been running her business for 16 years. She began selling kitchen utensils like dishes, frying pans, and pots. Little by little she has begun to sell other products that her clientele has been asking for. She sells in different poorer areas from 2pm to 6pm. Mercy is asking for a loan so that she can increase sells and satisfy her clients. Her clients are asking for perfumes and cosmetics which are a new line of products to her business. Marcy, 47, is married with 3 grown-up children of which she takes care of one who is 27. This son helps her in the business selling and collecting money. Mercy says that with more money to invest, she will be able to increase her income and continue to provide for the well-being of her family with a good home, as well as stability for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Mercy tiene su negocio desde hace 16 años. Se inicio vendiendo utensilios de cocina como vajillas, sartenes, juegos de ollas y poco a poco ha ido incrementado otras mercadería que su clientela le ha ido solicitando. Sus puntos de ventas son diferentes sectores área marginal y su atención es de 14PM a 18PM

Mercy solicita el préstamo para incrementar mas sus ventas y también cumplir a sus clientes. Le han pedido productos de perfumería y cosméticos que es nuevo en su línea de negocios.

Mercy es casada tiene 47 años y 3 hijos mayores de edad y a su cargo solo uno de 27 años. Su hijo la apoya en su negocio acompañándola en sus gestiones de ventas y cobros. Mercy indica que con su nueva inversión obtendrá otros ingresos que le permitirían seguir adecuando su vivienda dándole mayor bienestar y estabilidad a su familia y negocio.

loans.use: To invest in cosmetics and perfumes

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosita has been working as a seamstress out of her home for 20 years. She makes school uniforms, dresses, skirts, and blouses. She opened her business with savings from previous jobs when she began buying the necessary machines. Rosita offers good service to her clientele since not only does she make clothes, but also bags with traditional prints from the Galapagos Islands that she receives by air mail. She makes the bags to fill customer orders, and these customers refer her to others because of her good sewing quality. She is open from 8am to 8pm. Rosita will use the loan to buy fabric for shirts because she needs to fill orders for physical education uniforms and also to buy other goods that she does not make. Rosita, 52, is single with 3 children who live in the Galapagos Islands. Her 3 children are grown-up and have their own families. With increased income from the investment, Rosita says that she will continue impoving her home so that she can have a secure life.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosita tiene su taller de costura en su domicilio el mismo que tiene desde hace 20 años. Rosita produce uniformes escolares, vestidos faldas y blusas. Se inicio con ahorros generados por trabajos anteriores y con esos ahorros fue comprando sus maquinarias para poco a poco ir implementando su taller. Rosita da un buen servicio a su clientela ya que no solo ahora produce ropa, sino que también esta produciendo bolsos con estampados típicos de la Islas Galápagos los cuales los envían por avión. Los bolsos los realiza por pedidos ya que fue referida por su buena calidad en su costura. Rosita atiende a sus clientes desde las 8AM a 20PM

Rosita utilizara su crédito en la compra de telas camisetas ya que tiene pedidos de uniformes de educación física y también compra de otras mercaderías que ella no produce.

Rosita es soltera tiene 52 y 3 hijos los mismos que viven en las Isla Galápagos todos son mayores de edad y con sus respectivas familias. Doña Rosita indica que con las utilidades generadas en esta nueva inversión seguirá adecuando vivienda para darle mayor seguridad a su vida

loans.use: To buy more fabric

loans.name: Eddy

texts.en:
Eddy has 19 years of experience selling meat. He learned this trade when he began working with his uncle when he was 12. With all of his experience he decided to use this meat selling business as a source of income to take care of his family. Eddy asked a friend who sold meat for a loan and 50 pounds of meat and meat products in order to open his business. Eddy sells his products from a cart going across the island to sell door to door. He sells from 8:30am-12pm and from 4pm-7pm. Eddy is asking for a loan in order to increase business due to greater demand. He also wants to fix his cart or buy a new one. Eddy, 31, is young and hard working. He puts a lot of effort into what he does. His wife helps him cleaning the meat so that they can be successful and provide a good life and education for their 3 children.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Eddy tiene 19 años de experiencia en venta de carne. Oficio que lo aprendió porque trabajo con un tío a la edad de 12 años. Con esta experiencia Eddy decidió que este negocio de carne seria su fuente de ingreso y sustento para su familia. Eddy le solicito a un amigo expendedor de carnes que le diera crédito el mismo que accedió ayudarlo y le dio 50 libras de carnes y vísceras con lo que Eddy emprendió su negocio. Eddy expende su producto en un triciclo recorriendo el sector de la isla dando un servicio de venta de puerta a puerta. Inicia su recorrido en la mañana desde la 8:30AM a 12PM y en las tardes desde las 16PM a 19PM.

Eddy solicita préstamo para incrementar su negocio debido a que su demanda ha crecido y también quiere readecuar su triciclo o comprarse otro.

Eddy es un joven trabajador tiene 31 años y se esfuerza bastante junto con su esposa que lo ayuda mucho en la limpieza de las carnes para de esta manera salir adelante y poder darles mejor bienestar y educación a sus 3 hijos.

loans.use: To buy meat and improve his selling cart

loans.name: Serafín

texts.en:
Serafin has been running a hardware store from his home for 8 years with the help of his wife and children. Serafin sells his diverse array of hardware products to his clients 7 days a week from 7am to 10pm. Serafin is asking for a loan to expand his business by buying paint, cables, light bulbs, tubes, and other products. He needs to do this because his clientele has increased and there are no other hardware stores in the area. By expanding his business, Serafin will be able to satisfy his clients' needs. Serafin, 34, is married with 3 children. His wife and kids help him run the business because they know that this is where the money comes from that allows them to get an education and food. In addition to his business, Serafin knows how to build homes. When he is asked to do some construction work, he always goes because this adds to his income and helps to improve his home and the lives of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Serafín tiene su ferretería ubicada en su domicilio desde hace 8 años donde su esposa he hijos lo ayudan en su atención. Serafín brinda sus diversos productos de ferretería a sus clientes todos los días de la semana y los atiende desde las 7AM a 22PM

Serafín solicita crédito con la finalidad de incrementar su negocio en comprar pinturas, cables, focos, tubos y otros. Ya que su clientela se ha incrementado debido a que no existe otra ferretería cerca de donde esta ubicado. Y Serafín de esta manera podrá cumplir a sus clientes y satisfacer sus necesidades.

Serafín es casado tiene 34 años y 3 hijos. La esposa y los hijos lo apoyan en el negocio por que ellos saben que es su fuente de ingresos que les permite seguirles dando mejora alimentación y educación. Adicionalmente a su negocio Serafín sabe el arte de construir vivienda y cuando lo llaman para alguna obra siempre esta para no dejarla pasar, ya que es una oportunidad de obtener otros ingresos que sumados a la ganancia dada por su negocio mejoran mas su calidad de vida la de su familia y hogar.

loans.use: To invest in products to sell

loans.name: Bilhatu

texts.en:
Mrs. Bilhatu Y. N. runs a knitting shop in Maraba community. She has been in the business for over 5 years. Her experience has enabled her to train over 100 women in knitting. These women now have their own shops that are running successfully.

Mrs. Bilhatu is married with 6 children and 3 dependents. Her husband is a worker in a private company. Mrs. Bilhatu has been working very hard through her knitting business and she earns about N10,000 ($80) a week. It has enabled her to support the family in terms of school fees and feeding them. She has been able to support her husband and to build their own house.

She is part of the group Kauna 1 Maraba which has 8 members in total. They will distribute the loan amongst themselves as dictated by their business plan.

loans.use: Knitting - personal business and training others

loans.name: Hanny

texts.en:
Mrs. Hanny S. is a petty trader and specializes in the buying and selling of food items: rice, beans, tomatoes, vegetables, etc. Her business is located near her house in the Masaka community and has been operating her business for 2 years.

Mrs. Hanny is married with 3 children and her husband is a civil servant. His salary is fixed and inadequate to take care of the family’s basic needs. This problem has motivated her into starting her micro-finance business and earns her an average of $7.50 per day. This complements her husband’s effort by helping to provide for her daily family meals and other domestic needs.

Mrs. Hanny has gained patronage from many people within and outside her immediate environment – mainly because of her quality goods and service. She has a desire to provide quantity and quality goods in order to keep up with her demands.

Mrs. Hanny is part of the Gaskiya Cooperative group. This group has 8 members and each will receive a portion of the loan according to their group business plan.

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy and sell foodstuffs common in the Nigerian community (rice, yams, oil, beans, etc)

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Mrs. Lydia T. specializes in the production and selling of kunu. Kunu is a local drink made from guinea corn and is acceptable in all parts of Abuja. It is cheap and therefore affordable to the rich and poor. Mrs. Lydia has been in the business for over a year and has enjoyed being a member of the Miracle Group.

Mrs. Lydia is married to Mr. T. who is a civil servant and they have one child. Her desire is to live an economically productive life without depending on her husband for every need of the family. She has not completed secondary school, but still contributes greatly to her family. Through making and selling of "kunu" she is able to generate $5.50 a day. This helps to offset in paying some of the bills like feeding, medical, etc.

Mrs. Lydia intends to increase production and provide kunu to other shops. She also intends to supply offices during their break periods. The demand is high because of the warmer weather and her quality.

Mrs. Lydia is part of the Miracle Cooperative group. The group has 11 members and will distribute the loan according to their business plan.

loans.use: Lydia desires to serve local food and drink to a growing customer base. She will use her loan to buy local ingredients and supplies to meet the high demand.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.en:
Maria Dolores, 48, is married and has three daughters, ages 21, 22, and 24. Her husband Agustin has worked in basic chemical services for 25 years. Nevertheless, Maria saw the need to earn an extra income to cover the household expenses, and it was in this way that, seven years ago, she began selling cosmetics and nutrition products from her home. Her love for sales and entrepreneurial character have allowed her to carry out her project and keep it going for so long.

Maria's love for her family motivates her to work hard day after day. She currently needs a $275 loan to purchase merchandise so that she can offer her clients greater variey and better service. You can play an important role in the success of this business. Maria appreciates your support and generosity.

La señora Maria Dolores tiene 48 años de edad, es casada y madre de tres hijas, de 21, 22 y 24 años. Agustín, su esposo, es obrero en servicios químicos básicos desde hace 25 años. Sin embargo, Maria vio la necesidad de obtener un ingreso extra para apoyar a los gastos del hogar, y fue así como desde hace siete años inició con las ventas de cosméticos y productos nutricionales, que realiza en su propio domicilio, el gusto por las ventas y su espíritu emprendedor le han permitido llevar a cabo su proyecto y permanecer por tanto tiempo en el negocio.

El amor hacia su familia han motivado a Maria a esforzarse día a día, ahora ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 275 dólares que utilizará para la compra de mercancía, para tener mayor variedad que ofrecerles a sus clientes y brindarles un mejor servicio. Tú puedes ser parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio, Maria agradece tu generosidad y apoyo.

loans.use:
Purchase of merchandise

compra de mercancía

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.en:
Juana Maria was born and raised in Escobedo, Nuevo León. She is married with five children, 3 girls and 2 boys, who are also married. Four years ago, Juana started her own business selling perfume and crafts by catalog. She wanted to earn an extra income, because, even though her husband Juan works, the wages he earns are not enough to cover their family's needs.

In order to fill her clients' orders and offer them good service, Maria needs to $275 loan to purchase merchandise. Play a part in Maria's life and business, your help will be greatly appreciated, act now.

La señora Juana Maria es originaria de la localidad de Escobedo, en el estado de Nuevo León, ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos, 3 mujeres y 2 hombres, que ya están casados. Desde hace cuatro años, Juana inició su propio negocio con la venta de perfumes y manualidades por catálogo, para obtener un ingreso extra, porque aunque Juan, su esposo, trabaja en un taller de torno el salario que obtiene no es suficiente para cubrir todas las necesidades de su hogar.

Para poder surtir los pedidos de sus clientes y ofrecerles un buen servicio, Maria necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 275 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía. Forma parte fundamental en el negocio y en la vida de María, tu colaboración será de gran bendición, no lo dudes más.

loans.use:
To purchase merchandise

Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a very active entrepreneur. She is married with three children, ages 12, 18 and 22. Four years ago her husband lost his job, and to help cover the family’s expenses, Paty began her jewelry and cosmetics business. This work helped her and her family move forward and overcome their economic problems.

Currenly Patricia has many orders to fill since here clientele has multiplied, but she does not have sufficient capital to invest in the purchase of merchandise. She needs a $200 loan, which she will pay back in 3 to 6 months. The ability to help this family is in your hands. They could have a better life. Don't hesitate, support Paty.

Patricia es una mujer emprendedora y muy activa, ella es casada y tiene tres hijos, de 12, 18 y 22 años de edad. Hace cuatro años, su esposo Arturo se quedó desempleado y para ayudar a solventar los gastos del hogar, Paty inició su negocio de venta de joyería y cosméticos, esta actividad le ayudó a ella y a su familia a salir adelante y poder superar los problemas económicos.

Ahora Patricia tiene muchos pedidos, ya que sus clientes se ha multiplicado, pero ella no cuenta con el capital suficiente para invertir en la compra de la mercancía por lo que necesita de un crédito por $ 200 dólares, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. En tus manos esta el poder ayudar a esta familia, y que puedan tener una mejor vida, no lo dudes más y apoya a Paty.

loans.use:
To purchase merchandise

Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Silvia Nelly

texts.en:
Silvia Nelly is married with six children, two of which are married, two are working and her two youngest daughters are still in school. Her husband Alfredo runs a machine shop from their home, but they don’t have a steady income. It was difficult at times to cover all of their expenses, so 17 years ago Silvia decided to earn another income and has since been preparing and selling Mexican sweets and fixed-price dishes.

Silvia only wants the best for her family. Her love for her children has motivated her to keep her business growing for so long. Currently she needs a $275 loan to purchase ingredients necessary for the meals she prepares because she would like to offer her clients a wider variety of dishes. Play a key role in this business and in Silvia's life. She and her family truly appreciate your help.

La señora Silvia Nelly, es casada y tiene 6 hijos, de los cuales 2 están casados, 2 trabajando y sus dos hijas más pequeñas aún estudian. Alfredo, su esposo, tiene un taller mecánico en su propio domicilio, por lo que en no tiene un ingreso fijo y en ocasiones era difícil solventar todos los gastos, por la necesidad de un ingreso extra, hace 17 años Silvia se dedica a la elaboración y venta de antojitos mexicanos y comidas corridas.

Silvia sólo busca lo mejor para su familia, el amor hacia sus hijos la ha motivado todo este tiempo a continuar con su negocio y hacerlo crecer, ahora necesita de un préstamo por $ 275 dólares que utilizará en la compra de los insumos que requiere para la elaboración de sus comidas, porque quiere ofrecer una mayor variedad de platillos a sus clientes. Se parte fundamental en el negocio y la vida de Silvia, ella y su familia agradecen sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use:
To purchase ingredients

compra de insumos

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.en:
Juan de Dios is an entrepreneurial and responsible man who wants to provide the best for his family. He is married with four children. He works as a laborer in a firm, but the salary he earns is not enough to cover the household expenses. For this reason, five years ago he started his own business in which he sells kitchen and footwear articles in his home city of García, Nuevo León. This is how Juan earns the extra income he needs for the home and for his children's schooling.

At this time, Juan is in need of a loan in the amount of $675 to acquire merchandise. He would like to increase his sales and knows that to make that possible, he will have to offer a larger selection to his customers. He is offering to repay this amount within 6 to 12 months. You can improve the life of this family by supporting Juan in his business. Don't hesitate any longer, they are waiting for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan de Dios es un hombre emprendedor y responsable, que desea darle lo mejor a su familia, él es casado y tiene cuatro hijos, trabaja de obrero en una empresa, pero el salario que recibe es insuficiente para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, por esta razón, desde hace cinco años, inició su propio negocio donde comercializa artículos de cocina y calzado, en la localidad de García, Nuevo León, de donde es originario, es esta manera en la que Juan obtiene el ingreso extra que necesita para su hogar y para la escuela de sus hijos.

En estos momentos Juan necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $ 675 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía, porque quiere incrementar sus ventas y sabe que será posible si tiene más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes, él ofrece regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Tú puedes mejorar la vida de esta familia, apoyando a Juan con su negocio, no lo dudes más, ellos te están esperando.

loans.use: Acquire merchandise

loans.name: Blanca Araceli

texts.en:
Blanca is married with five children, two of whom are 3-year-old twin boys and three daughters ages 1, 7 and 9. Her husband is a chauffeur and earns a very low salary. Fortunately, they were able to purchase their own house, but her husband’s salary must cover the payments. For this reason, Blanca saw the need to earn an extra income to help them with all the household expenses. That is how she came to start her own grocery business which she runs out of her home. This way she avoids neglecting her family while being able to work.

At this time, Blanca is in need of a loan of $475 to buy merchandise stocks for her business. It hasn’t been easy for her to move her business and family forward, but she is determined to work hard to offer her children a better quality of life. Become a part of the growth of this business. This family's wellbeing is in your hands, and they appreciate your generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Blanca es casada, tiene cinco hijos, dos de ellos son gemelos de 3 años de edad y tres hijas de 1, 7 y 9 años, su esposo es chofer y recibe un salario muy bajo. Afortunadamente les fue posible adquirir su propia casa, pero los pagos de ésta se descuentan del salario de su esposo, por lo que Blanca vio la necesidad de obtener un ingreso extra que pudiera ayudarles con todos los gastos del hogar, fue así como inició con la venta de abarrotes, que realiza en su domicilio, de esta manera no descuida a su familia y puede trabajar.

En estos momentos, Blanca requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para surtir su negocio, no ha sido fácil para ella sacar adelante su negocio y su familia, pero está dispuesta a trabajar mucho para ofrecerles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Forma parte del crecimiento de este negocio, en tus manos esta el bienestar de esta familia, ellos agradecen tu generosidad.

loans.use: Acquire merchandise stocks

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Mr. Cesar has owned his business for four years. "My shop is very small and I would like to expand it a little bit because right now some customers have to wait outside while I attend to others. I would like $1200 to expand my shop."

Translated from Spanish by Alexis Hult, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Cesar tiene su negocio desde hace 4 años. “Mi negocio es muy pequeño y me gustaría ampliarlo un poco ya que a veces la gente tiene que esperar afuera para que salga la gente que estoy atendiendo debido al espacio tan reducido que tengo”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para ampliar mi negocio.

loans.use: To expand his business.

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.en:
Olga Lidia is married with four children ages 6, 11, 13 and 16. Her husband Lorenzo works as an operator in a construction firm, but Olga saw the need to earn an extra income to improve their living conditions and offer her children a quality education. For this reason, for the past eight years she has been selling chemical products, a business which she runs out of her garage.

Olga now needs a loan of $375 to buy merchandise to stock her business and allow it to grow. The growth of this business and the wellbeing of this family are in your hands. Don't hesitate any longer and offer your support.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Olga Lidia es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, de 6, 11, 13 y 16 años de edad. Lorenzo, su esposo, trabaja como operador en una empresa constructora, pero Olga veía la necesidad de obtener un ingreso extra para poder mejorar las condiciones en las que vivían y otorgarles una educación de calidad a sus hijos, por esta razón desde hace ocho años se dedica a la venta de productos químicos, su negocio lo tiene en la cochera de su casa.

Ahora Olga necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $ 375 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para surtir su negocio y poder hacerlo creer. El crecimiento de este negocio y el bienestar de esta familia está en tus manos, no lo pienses más y apóyala.

loans.use: Acquire merchandise stocks

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.en:
Juan Carlos is a craftsman who works in leather. He buys cattle hides and tans them and then sells the finished leather to other craftsman for use in making leather jackets, shoes, and suitcases. In this way, he generates jobs for other leather artisans. He is studying Biochemistry at the Main State University of San Andrés, in the city of La Paz. He lives at home with his parents on 23rd of March Street in the city of El Alto. His shop is located in the same house. He is 29 years old. Juan Carlos works with his brothers, for whom he provides a source of work and the loan will be used to buy the raw material.

This is his first loan with IMPRO, and the evaluation he underwent was positive, which allows him to take out the loan that he has requested.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan Carlos es artesano y trabaja en cuero. Compra cuero de ganado vacuno para la transformación del mismo en materia prima y es de esta forma que comercializa su producto a otros artesanos para la elaboración de chamarras, calzados y maletines, con lo cual genera fuentes de trabajo para otros artesanos en cuero. Es estudiante de la Universidad Estatal Mayor de San Andrés de la ciudad de La Paz en la carrera de Bio-Química, Vive en la Casa de sus padres en la Calle 23 de Marzo de la Ciudad de El Alto, su taller se encuentra ubicado en el mismo domicilio y tiene 29 años. Juan Carlos trabaja con sus hermanos a quienes proporciona una fuente de trabajo y el crédito lo destinará para la compra de materia prima. Es el primer crédito en Impro, y la evaluación que se ha efectuado es positiva, lo cual le permite acceder al crédito que solicita.

loans.use: Working capital to buy cow hides for tanning

loans.name: Sipriano

texts.en:
Mr. T. sells roast chicken from his business on one of the major streets in the Benito Juarez neighborhood. He cooks the chicken himself, but because his business doesn't have a seating area he can only sell for take-out. "I would like to expand my business and add some tables. Many people come here to eat but don't stay and buy because I don't have seating. I'm asking for $1200 to change this."

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

El Sr. T. tiene su negocio ubicado en la colonia Benito Juárez, sobre una de las calles principales de ese sector, el tiene la venta de pollos asados, él mismo los prepara, como no cuenta con un comedor, todo lo que vende es para llevar. "Quisiera ver la posibilidad de ampliar mi negocio e instalar varias mesas para que la gente venga a comer ya que mucha de ella al ver que no cuento con ese servicio ya no me compran les pido su ayuda para lograrlo, se requieren $1,200.00 dlls".

loans.use: To expand business and add a seating area.

loans.name: Griselda

texts.en:
Mrs. Griselda is a widow who has been selling Veracruz-style tamales for a year. "My business is on a street where lots of people pass by. Right now I put the pots on a table but I would like to buy a cart so I can move around and sell my tamales on all the streets. That's why I'm asking for $1000."

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

La Sra. Griselda es viuda y tiene un negocio en donde vende tamales estilo Veracruz desde hace 1 año. “Mi negocio esta ubicado en una calle en donde pasa mucha gente tengo una mesita en donde pongo las ollas, pero me gustaría comprar una carrucha para poder moverme por todas las calles a vender mis tamales”.Solicito $ 1,000.0 dlls para comprar la carrucha.

loans.use: To buy a cart.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en: Mrs. Thanh and her husband have 4 children between 17 and 8 years of age. They do not have any land for cultivation. She raises pigs at a hut. Her husband is a hired laborer. She is supporting 4 children going to school. She has repaid three loans. Their income increased by $2/person/month. Average income is low at $8 person/month. Now she asks to borrow $100 for raising pigs.

loans.use: raises pigs at home

loans.name: Anh

texts.en: Mrs. Mai has 2 children, 42 and 36. Miss Anh, her first daughter, was married and has 2 children, who are twins. Miss Vui, Mrs. Mai’s second daughter, is  mentally retarded. Mrs. Mai lives together with her two daughters in a hut. Mrs. Mai is old, 82, but she still works to sell confections at her hut. The family has a little land for cultivation, about 2000 square meters to plant rice. Mr. Xuat, Miss Anh’s husband, works as a daily laborer, but the work is not stable. Miss Anh has already repaid a loan of $75 for the project and income increased by about $2.31/person/month. However, average income is low at $9/person/month. Now she wants to borrow a loan of $100 to expand the sales of confections and rice planting.

loans.use: sell confections at home

loans.name: Homa

texts.en: Homa is 18 years old. She lives with 6 members of her family in district 7 in Kabul, Afghanistan. She needs a loan for her son who owns a retail shop and would like to expand it. He is the youngest in his family after his father died 6 years ago. He wants to take a loan from AFSG to expand his business and buy more rice, onions, potatoes, and some extra materials and be able to build a close relationship with big shopkeepers. He will continue to work hard to find a good monthly income for his family. *** Note: The picture featured in this buisness profile is the husband or relative of the female entrepreneur. In Afghanistan, it is culturally unacceptable to post a picture of a woman on the internet, but the loan is for the female entrepreneur. ****

loans.use: Buying Milk,Drinks,Rice,Ghee etc

loans.name: Dadakishi

texts.en: Dadakishi is a resident of the Beylagan region. He is 56 years old and has two sons. He is engaged in cattle breeding which is the usual business in rural areas. He has a shed in his houseyard where he keeps livestock. Once they are grown, he sells his livestock or delivers it to butchery shops. He has four heads of livestock now. He wants to breed sheep as well to expand the business and increase his income. He applied to the Normicro Beylagan branch for the first time to borrow $500 to buy sheep.

loans.use: To buy 10 sheep

loans.name: Karima

texts.en: Karima is 35 years old and lives with 4 members of her family in district 2 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is a beautician and is in her third cycle loan. She spends the money in her beauty parlor shop to create good business and would now like another loan once again from AFSG to expand her business. She wants to make her shop larger and buy more cosmetics and materials. Karima wants to help her family with the  business and she will be very happy with the AFSG loan.

loans.use: To buy extra matrials for a hairdressing shop

loans.name: Fazila

texts.en: Fazala is 40 years old. She lives with five members of her family in District 3 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is uneducated and is a tailor. She wants to support her family because she wants help her husband who is not working. She requests a loan from AFS to buy a sewing machine and extra materials to continue her business. She plans to work hard and find more customers in order to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Anah

texts.en: Anah is 26 years old and lives with 4 members of her family in Distrect 2 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is single and is a tailor. She wants to help her father who is old and she doesn’t have any brothers to help them. This is the 3rd cycle loan that she has taken from AFSG. She used the previous loans to buy new machines and other materials. Now she wants to take a loan to expand her business with more students and more machines. This is one of her best wishes: to improve herself and help her father and family.

loans.use: To buy extra materials for tailoring shop

loans.name: Nabila

texts.en: Nabila is 45 years old and lives with 6 members of his family in district two in Kabul, Afghanistan. She is on her cycle 4 loan and spends it in her tailor shop. She uses it to create good business and to fund the rent payment of her house, because her husband died 3 years ago. So she supports her children and she is the only worker of her family. Nabila wants to work hard so that her children never face with any difficulty in school and other parts of their lives.

loans.use: To expand tailor shop with more materials.

loans.name: Sumrud

texts.en: Sumrud S. owns a couple of cows in the small village of Shahnerzerli, in the Devechi region of Azerbaijan. She is raising cattle to sell for slaughter as well as raising milking cows in order to sell the milk to the merchants in the local markets and bazaar. Sumrud is looking for funding in order to purchase a couple more cows so that she can increase her product output and therefore increase her family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Czarina

texts.en: Czarina is 60 years old lives with 5 members of her family in district 3 in Kabul, Afghanistan. She took a loan out for her son who is a shopkeeper that sells sickle. She is in her cycle 3 of the loan and her son will use the loan to buy more sickle to sell, and some kits to fix the sickles.She wants to take another loan out to increase the business of  sickle shop, to enlarge the shop, and to solve all the economical problems of his family.

loans.use: Expand sickle shop with repair kits, and more sickles.

loans.name: Amine

texts.en: Amine M. lives in the small village of Shahnerzerli, in the Devechi region of Azerbaijan where she is beginning to raise cattle. Amine is looking for funding so that she can purchase more cattle in order to grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Gulustan

texts.en: Gulustan H. raises cattle in the small village of Rehimli, in the Devechi region of Azerbaijan. Gulustan and her family want to increase the quantity of their livestock in order to increase their income. Gulstan is looking for funding so that she can invest in purchasing a few more calves for her livestock.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Shahsta

texts.en:
Shahsta is 30 years old. She lives with three members of her family in District 2 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She has rented a shop to start a bakery.  She works hard to expand the business because her husband is jobless. Sometimes he helps her bring wood and performs other tasks.

The responsibility to work lies with her. She wants to take a loan to improve her life and business.  The money will be used to purchase flour and wood so she can bake more and sell more.

loans.use: to buy more woods,flour etc.

loans.name: Seriye

texts.en: Seriye A. and her husband (her husband is pictured) own a few cows in the small village of Rehimli, in the Devechi Region of Azerbaijan. Seriye has applied for funding in order to invest in a few more calves for her current livestock. Seriye and her husband want to increase their livestock in order to grow their small livestock business and increase their income.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Shah Be Be

texts.en: Shah is 55 years old lives with 6 family members in district two in Kabul Afghanistan. Her husband died in the Afghanistan war and she also has a son. Her son owns a gallery shop and they want to expand it. So she wants to take a loan out for her son to expand the business and get more income, improving his life and to support his family economically.

loans.use: Expand jewelry store.

loans.name: Gutekin

texts.en: Gutekin I. owns a few cows in the small village of Rehimli, in the Deveci region of Azerbaijan. Gutekin has applied for funding so that she can invest in another cow. She would like to grow her small business of selling cows for slaughter and selling cows' milk to the local bazaar and markets.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Zahide

texts.en: Zahide H. owns a small herd of sheep in the village of Rehimli, in the Devechi region of Azerbaijan. She raises sheep for wool, cheese and slaughter. Zahide has applied for funding so that she can afford to increase the size of her herd, thereby increasing her and her family’s monthly income.

loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Susal

texts.en: Susal M. owns and operates a small market in his neighborhood in the village of Rehimli, in the Devechi region of Azerbaijan. Susal’s mother (pictured) is a retired school director who occupies a lot of her time by helping her son run the small market. Susal is looking for funding so that he can increase the quantity and variety of his inventory as well as make some minor repairs to his shop.

loans.use: To increase quantity and variety of inventory. Minor repairs to shop.

loans.name: Irade

texts.en: Irade E. owns and takes care of a small number of livestock in the village of Rehimli, in the Devechi region of Azerbaijan. Irade is looking for funding in order to invest in more calves so that she can increase the quantity of her livestock as well as purchase some items that she needs for making minor repairs on her barn.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Sevan

texts.en: Sevan M. (his wife is pictured) owns a few livestock animals in the village of Rehimli, in the Devechi region of Azerbaijan. Sevan is looking for funding so that he can purchase more livestock in order to increase his family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en: Kamal M. owns and operates a small market in the village of Rehimli, in the region of Devechi in Azerbaijan. Kamal is looking for funding so that he can increase the quantity and variety of his inventory. He knows that he has to keep his inventory modern if he is to keep his current customers and attract new clientele.

loans.use: To increase the quantity and variety of his inventory

loans.name: Natavan

texts.en: Natavan B. owns and operates a salon in the town of Devechi, located on the North East coast of Azerbaijan. Natavan is looking for funding so that she can modernize her salon by purchasing new and better equipment.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment for her salon

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: Vann S. is 38 years old and sells Khmer noodles near the garment factory in Phnom Penh.  Her husband helps her with this business, and they earn $7.50/day combined.  They have 4 children--1 works at the garment factory and 2 others help with the family business.  Vann S. will use this loan to buy plates and dishes for her foodstall.  In the future, she would like to sell fruit at the market and see her children finish high school.

loans.use: To buy plates and dishes for noodle shop

payments.comment:
Dear Kiva Lender,

Great news! Vann Sina has repaid the Kiva loan early! Kiva and CREDIT MFI make every effort to be as transparent as possible so you can trust the information we give you. In this case, we didn’t let you know that the loan had been repaid at the time. Occasionally, when a loan is repaid early, the payment schedule posted on Kiva doesn’t always match the records of our micro finance partner in Cambodia, CREDIT MFI. As in life, the system doesn’t always run perfectly, but when there is a discrepancy we will alert you as soon as possible so you have all the information about your investment.

On the upside, the issue occurred because the client’s business is so successful! Your loan made that possible. Soon you will see a repayment posted on the client’s profile that is larger than the usual amount. This will end the loan and return the funds to your account. We hope you will choose to loan the repaid funds to another entrepreneur who would a like a chance to grow their business as well. 

If you have any questions, please post them as a comment on this borrowers site and I will be happy to respond. I also encourage you to write comments on the pages of your loan recipients so we can pass along your good wishes to the borrowers.

We sincerely apologize for the oversight and are putting policies in place to make sure that it doesn’t happen again. Thank you for giving poor entrepreneurs in Cambodia a chance at success! 

Best regards,

Sopheap Khiev, Kiva partnership coordinator, Cambodia
Mr. Chan Mach, General Manager, CREDIT MFI, Cambodia

loans.name: Khumare

texts.en: Khumare A. (her husband is pictured) owns and operates a small clothing shop in the town of Devechi’s bazaar. Devechi is located on the North Eastern coast of Azerbaijan. Khumare is looking for funding so that she can increase the quantity and variety of her inventory. She wants to expand her inventory to include more modern clothing, which the market in Azerbaijan is demanding.

loans.use: To increase the quantity and variety of her inventory

loans.name: Huy Vong

texts.en: Huy Vong R. is 33 years old and works in a garment factory earning $2.50/day.  Her husband is a construction worker and earns $10/day.  Together, they have 1 small child.  R. is taking this loan out to buy construction materials for her husband's business.  In the future, they hope to open a shop that sells construction materials so they can raise their standard of living.  They also are confident that it will give them enough income to send their children to university.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Nhan

texts.en: Nhan S. is 54 years old and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia with her husband (who appears in the photo) and their 5 children.  She works selling groceries and earns $4/day, while her husband earns the same selling groceries at a different location.  One of their children helps out by contributing the wages they earn at the garment factory.  Nhan S. will use this loan to buy more grocery items so that her family can increase their income.  In the future, she would like to send all of her children to university.

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en: Tahir is a resident of the Beylagan region. He is 59 years old. He is engaged in cattle breeding as most people in rural areas are. He breeds cattle, sells them, or slaughters and delivers meat to butchery shops. He currently has two cows. He wants to buy a new cow for breeding and when it calves, the number of livestock will increase. He has applied to Normicro Beylagan branch for a loan. Ne needs to borrow $500 to buy a good cow.

loans.use: To buy one cow

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Phan S. is 26 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their 2 young children.  She sells a type of Cambodian meatballs and can earn $8/day, while her husband is a mototaxi driver.  She will use this loan to repair their home in preparation for the rainy season.  She would like to continue with her current business so that she may send her children to school.

loans.use: To repair home to prevent flooding during rainy season

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea S. is 35 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their 3 young children.  S. works as a teacher and earns $6/day and her husband earns $6/day working as a mototaxi driver.  They will use this loan to buy a tuk-tuk (taxi) so that her husband can earn more money driving around tourists.

loans.use: To buy tuk-tuk (taxi trailer)

loans.name: Subhan

texts.en: Subhan E. owns and operates a clothing shop in the town of Devechi’s bazaar. Devechi is located on the North Eastern coast of Azerbaijan. Subhan is applying for funding so that he can expand his inventory to include more seasonal clothing. Summer is approaching quickly and the styles of clothing that the public wears are becoming more modern. He wants to ensure that he will have the product that his customers are looking for.

loans.use: To expand his inventory

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en: Rahima is 40 years old and lives with 4 members of her family in District 2 in Kabul, Afghanistan. She is a tailor and helps her family because her husband has a smaller salary than she does and he wants her to continue working. She is in her 4th loan cycle and bought new machines and sewing materials. She wants to take a loan to expand her business. Rahima wants to buy  an electronic machine to sew nicer designs and meet all of her customers' orders.

loans.use: Buy new sewing machines and expand her tailor shop.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en: Lay H. is 51 years old and lives in Phnom Penh taking care of her 4 children.  Her husband is a mechanic and earns $6/day.  Three of her children are students, and one daughter (pictured here) has already started her own family.  They also have a nephew that lives with them.  She will use this loan to repair her home in preparation for the rainy season.  In the future, she would like to send her children and her nephew to university.

loans.use: To repair home

loans.name: Arif

texts.en: Arif H. owns and operates a refrigerator and washing machine repair shop in the town of Devechi, which is located on the North Eastern coast of Azerbaijan. Arif is looking for funding so that he can purchase modern tools to work with. He knows that if he can get the tools necessary to do the job properly, he will save much time and increase the efficiency of his business. This will allow him to complete more jobs per day which will increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase new and more advanced tools

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Sem S. is 45 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their 4 children.  She sells watermelon in the market and her husband is a security guard.  Together, they earn about $12/day.  S. will use this loan to buy some sugar cane and a juice cart so that she can start a new business.  She is confident that she can sell a lot of juice and boost her income so that she will be able to send her children to high school.

loans.use: To buy sugar cane and a juice cart

loans.name: Vusal

texts.en: Vusal M. (his wife is pictured) has a small orchard on his property in the town of Devechi, which is located on the North Eastern coast of Azerbaijan. Vusal is looking for funding so that he can purchase more trees in order to expand his orchard into the other portion of his property.

loans.use: To purchase trees to expand his orchard

loans.name: Askerova

texts.en: M. is 37 year old, and a resident of Beylagan. She has three children. She breeds cattle in their house yard as most people do in rural areas. She breeds cattle, and when they are grown she sells them. She also sells milk and dairy products. Her husband is not working anywhere and they are engaged in this business together as it is their only source of earning a living. They want to buy two more calves to breed them. They applied to Normicro Beylagan branch to borrow $400 for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy two calves

loans.name: Qamar Gul

texts.en: Qamar Gul is 60 years old lives alone in district 3 in Kabul, Afghanistan. She is a shopkeeper has a retail food shop. She lost 8 members of her family in the war. She is the only one who takes care of the family and has less access to capital. She is asking for a loan to purchase more food materials  for her shop and to gain more income to support her family economically.

loans.use: Buy more food for her retail food shop.

loans.name: Guloysha

texts.en: Guloysha is 51 years old, and a resident of the Beylagan region of Azerbaijan. She breeds cattle in the house yard. Cattle breeding is traditional for rural areas. She currently has two cows and two calves. She sells livestock when they are grown, and meets the needs of the family for dairy products. She lost her husband and she has one son. She earns a living for the family this way. She wants to expand the business and have more cows. Therefore, she has applied to Normicro Beylagan branch. She needs to borrow $400 to buy one more cow.

loans.use: To buy one cow

loans.name: Chim

texts.en: Chim S. sells rice and Khmer food near a garment factory in Phnom Penh.  She earns $4/day while her husband earns $4.50/day working as a mototaxi.  They have 2 children, 1 of whom works in the garment factory earning $60/month.  S. will use this loan to buy a juice cart in order to sell sugar cane juice around the city.  She will use the additional income to send her daughters to university.

loans.use: To buy juice cart

loans.name: Som

texts.en: Som C. works in a garment factory in Phnom Penh earning $6/day.  She is 33 years old and has 1 young child with her husband (pictured here) who earns $1/day working as a soldier.  She will use this loan to build her family's first proper house.  In the future, she would like to buy a stall at the market to sell vegetables.

loans.use: To build home

loans.name: Surkhay

texts.en: Surkhay is a local resident of Beylagan. He is engaged in sheep breeding. He has 20 sheep at the moment. He sells sheep at the local animal market or slaughters them. He takes the herd out to graze very often. He needs to buy new heads of animals when he sells or slaughters some of them in order to keep up the number of the herd. Now he needs to buy 10 new sheep. His own funds are short and he has applied to Normicro Beylagan branch for a loan. He needs $400 to buy 10 sheep.

loans.use: To buy 10 sheep to add to the herd

loans.name: Ali Gul

texts.en: Ali Gul is 20 years old and lives with 6 members of his family in district 3 in Kabul, Afghanistan. His father is dead and is supporting his family. He is  a painter and his mother needs a loan from AFSG to create a shop for her son. He needs to buy painting kits to make butter he has been very happy with AFSG****Note the picture featured in this business profile is the husband or relative of the female entrepreneur in Afghanistan it is culturally unacceptable to post a picture of a woman on the internet but the loan is for the female entrepreneur.****

loans.use: to buy more rice ,oil,etc

loans.name: Nabila

texts.en: Nabila is 24 years old and lives with 3 members of her family in district 3 in Kabul, Afghanistan. She wants to support her husband and needs a loan from AFSG. Her husband is a tailer and needs money to buy new machines and materials and to expand to a larger shop. He wants to help his family start a new life. They are very happy AFSG has supported him…….*** Note: The picture featured in this business profile is the husband or relative of the female entrepreneur. In Afghanistan, it is culturally unacceptable to post a picture of a woman to the internet but the loan is for a female entrepreneur. ****

loans.use: Buy new machines for a tailor shop.

loans.name: Aziz Gul

texts.en: Aziz Gul Is 47 years old and  lives with 6 members of her family in district 5 in Kabul, Afghanistan. She is a tailor and is a good business dealer. She took a loan from AFSG and does good business with it and now wants to take a loan to buy more machines and new kits. Aziz Gulhe has good talent in her job and can do lots of work with a new loan to support her family and help her husband.

loans.use: To buy extra machines and expand her tailor shop

loans.name: Aqala

texts.en:
Aqala is 45 years old and lives with 4 members of her family in Distract 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is an uneducated woman. She is a knitting and she took money from AFSG to go into business because her husband has been dead for 5 years.

Now she wants take anther loan to increase her business. She knits at home and her son sell the products in the bazaar. She hopes to make this business better and help her family because she is their only support.

loans.use: To buy extra materials

loans.name: Nasima

texts.en:
Nasima is 47 years old and lives with 5 members of her family in District 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is a carpenter and works with members of her family in her home because her husband is dead.

She took one loan and rented a house for her carpentry shop, and now she wants to take anther loan to buy extra materials for working and furthering her business. It is one of her best wishes to be a success and help her family.

loans.use: To buy materials for carpentry

loans.name: Kiese Akwa

texts.en: Kiese Akwa L. was born in 1960 and is the mother of six children. Kiese has been in business since 1994. She has been selling soft drinks and clothing. Due to the high demand of her clients in the community, Kiese is requesting a loan of $1000 in order to buy 100 crates of beverages and purified water and to better serve her clients by generating additional profit, which she plans to reinvest in the business. Her long-term plan is open a cement warehouse.

loans.use: To buy 100 crates of beverages and purified water for resale.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Alpha Naniwatamo

texts.en: Alpha has been engaged in selling food since 1994. She started her business with a working capital of $72. Through hard work and determination to succeed, and with the help of Hope’s loans (a Microfinance organisation), Alpha increased the working capital to $1,100. She needs a loan of $1,000 in order to buy sacks of rice, sugar, boxes of salted fish and beans. Alpha was born in 1969 and she is married with seven children. She works very hard to make additional profit to support the children’s studies.

loans.use: To buy food goods such as rice, sugar, salted fish, and beans in bulk for resale.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Nadiya

texts.en:
Nadiya runs four little vending facilities where she sells a variety of spices and seasonings at the central food market in downtown Ivano-Frankivsk. Nadiya has been in business for 10 years. She has about $4,000 in inventory and presently her net profit amounts to around $1,000-$1,200 per month.

Nadiya is very friendly and cheery. Because of her cheerfulness and good service her total number of customers is consistently growing. Reasonable prices, hard-work and tenacity have helped her enterprise reach sustainability and success. The twenty loans she has received from “Nadiya Ukraine” are another reason why her business has been so successful. While working with our organization, Nadiya was able to purchase her fourth vending facility and increase her sales volume.

Nadiya has requested a loan for $600 to purchase 10 kilograms of dried mushrooms and a variety of different spices and seasonings that she will sell in her kiosks. This loan will help her re-supply her inventory and encourage more customers to come and buy from her. Increased sales will generate the necessary funds to sustain her business as well as to meet her family’s needs.

В Надії – чотири торгових точки, вона торгує різними спеціями та приправами на центральному продуктовому ринку в центрі Івано-Франківську. Вона займається цим бізнесом вже 10 років. Зараз в Надії в товар вкладено приблизно 4000 доларів. Щомісяця її чистий прибуток складає приблизно 1000-1200 доларів. Надія – привітна та життєрадісна. Завдяки її оптимістичному та гарному обслуговуванню кількість її покупців постійно зростає. Помірні ціни, наполеглива праця та цілеспрямованість допомогли Надії досягти стабільності та успіху. Двадцять позик, які вона отримала від „Надії України” також сприяли розвитку її бізнесу. Співпраця за нашою організацією надала їй можливість придбати четверту торгову точку та збільшити обсяги продажу. Надія просить про позику в 600 доларів для того, щоб закупити 10 кілограмів сухих грибів, різні спеції та приправи для роздрібної торгівлі. Позика допоможе Надії поповнити асортимент товарів та привабити більше покупців. Збільшення обсягів продажу допоможе Надії отримати необхідні кошти для подальшого розвитку бізнесу та потреб, які мають її рідні.

loans.use: To purchase 10 kg of dried mushrooms and an assortment of spices/seasonings

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is married and has a 5-year-old daughter. She worked for a while as a salesperson, and later decided to start her own venture. Three years ago, Oksana began selling women’s clothing and children’s shoes in one of the local markets.

Oksana has been an outstanding client with “Nadiya Ukraine”. She has received and promptly repaid a total of 14 loans which have had a considerable impact on the growth of her business. Presently, Oksana has about $1,600 of working capital, and her net profit amounts to around $600 per month.

Oksana has requested a loan for $700 to purchase 50 women’s sweaters and 40 pairs of shoes for children. She believes that a good variety of clothing items that are both comfortable and durable will sell well and will help her generate additional profit. Oksana is hoping to invest part of her profits in fulfilling one of her long-term plans of opening a second vending facility and significantly expanding her business.

Оксана – одружена, в неї є п’ятирічна дочка. Вона певний час працювала реалі затором, потім вирішила працювати на себе. Три роки тому Оксана почала торгувати жіночим одягом та дитячим взуттям на одному з місцевих ринків. В Оксани – чудова кредитна репутація в „Надії України”. Вона отримала та вчасно сплатила 14 позик, вони, в свою чергу, значно вплинули на ріст її бізнесу. Зараз, в Оксани приблизно 1600 доларів робочого капіталу, щомісячний чистий прибуток складає приблизно 600 доларів. Оксана просить про позику в 700 доларів для того, щоб закупити 50 жіночих светрів та 40 пар дитячого взуття. Вона вважає, що зручний та якісний одяг краще продаватиметься, а, отже, принесе їй додатковий прибуток. Оксана сподівається вкласти частину отриманих коштів у відкриття другої торгової точки та подальший розвиток її бізнесу.

loans.use: To broaden inventory selection

loans.name: Dmitriy

texts.en:
Dmitriy is married and has a 7-year-old son. He runs a successful business selling trendy clothing styles for young people. His inventory of good quality, durable, comfortable clothes provides great choices for passing customers to find just what they’re looking for.

Dmitriy is a focused, hard worker. He has been in business for twelve years now. His natural cheerfulness and optimism have helped his enterprise grow and flourish. The twelve loans he has received from “Nadiya Ukraine” have only added to the success of his business. Currently, Dmitriy has about $5,000 in inventory. His net profit amounts to $1,000 per month.

Dmitriy is requesting a loan for $800 to purchase 20 pairs of jeans and 10 jackets. He is hoping to increase his sales and earn extra income. Dmitriy is planning to invest generated revenue into the further expansion of his business and eventually open a new vending facility. He is hopeful that with hard work, determination, and financial assistance his business will continue to be successful and provide himself and his family with stable, long term income.

Дмитро – одружений, в нього є семирічний син. Він успішно займається бізнесом з продажу модного одягу для молоді. Його якісний та зручний одяг представлений в кіоску в широкому асортименті, що дозволяє покупцям знайти саме те, що вони шукають. Дмитро – наполегливий та працьовитий. Він займається бізнесом на протязі 12 років. Природна жвавість та оптимізм сприяли росту та розвитку його справи. Дванадцять позик, які Дмитро отримав від „Надії України”, також відіграли неабияку роль в досягненні ним успіху. Зараз в товарі у нього приблизно 5000 доларів. Щомісячний чистий прибуток складає 1000 доларів. Дмитро просить про позику в 800 доларів для того, щоб придбати 20 пар джинсів та 10 курток. Він сподівається збільшити обсяги продажу та отримати додатковий прибуток. Дмитро планує вкласти отримані кошти в подальший розвиток свого бізнесу та врешті-решт відкрити другу торгову точку. Він вважає, що завдяки наполегливій праці, цілеспрямованості та фінансовій підтримці його бізнес стане успішнішим, а родина завжди матиме стабільне, надійне джерело прибутку.

loans.use: To increase inventory stock

loans.name: Ruth Tweyo

texts.en: A 38 year-old woman, Ruth is married and has five children. She started her business in 1992 with a business capital of $50. According to Ruth, a loan of $600 would greatly help her expand her business in order to generate additional profit and better serve the clients in her community.

loans.use: To buy some crates of beverages and food goods in bulk for resale.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel M. sells music videos, movies on DVD and VCD in the evenings on Tihuanaku Avenue in the city of El Alto. He also works as a taxi driver during the day. He employs two people at his market stall. His income allows him to support his 75 year-old mother and his 12 year-old son. He lives in the Villa Tunari-Rio Seco zone of the city of El Alto.

The loan will be used to buy inventory, which will allow him to meet the demand for his products. Because of his good credit history, it is possible for him to take out a new loan in order to strengthen his commercial activities and thereby improve his income.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Samuel M., es comerciante de Videos Musicales, películas en DVD y VCD por la noches en la Av. Tihuanaku de la Ciudad de El Alto, asimismo trabaja como transportista del servicio público (TAXI) durante el día , emplea a dos personas para el puesto de venta, los ingresos que genera le permiten la manutención de su madres de 75 años y su pequeño hijo de 12 años. Vive en la Zona Villa Tunari – Rió Seco de la Ciudad de El Alto. El destino del crédito es para la compra de mercadería, misma que le permitirá satisfacer la cantidad de demanda que existe en su puesto de venta. Por su buen antecedente crediticio, le permite acceder a un nuevo crédito para poder fortalecer su actividad comercial y de esa forma mejorar sus ingresos económicos.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en: Laurence is a widow who supports her family through her business. She is 60 years old and has eight children. She started her business in 1997. Her determination to succeed makes her a strong woman, and she wants to expand her business in order to generate additional profit. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy a freezer, which would help her to better serve the high demand of clients in her community.

loans.use: To purchase prepaid phone cards in bulk for resale, and a freezer for soft drinks.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Ilda

texts.en:
Ilda lives in a rental on Avenida Buenos Aires, in the San Martín neighborhood of the city of La Paz, along with her husband Rene Tola. They have two small children. Ilda is 25 years old and she sells automotive lubricants at a small store located in the Las Lomas zone (on the edge of the city). She works alongside her husband, who also has income from working as a tailor, making suits and other clothing.

The loan Ilda is requesting is to augment her capital, since she has plenty of clients and would like to vary her business. She has a positive history with IMPRO, which qualifies her to receive another loan.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana M. M. is a merchant selling groceries on Avenida Final Buenos Aires in the city of La Paz. Her husband works as an assistant bricklayer (constructing houses), and they have two children, ages 6 and 10. They all live in her parents' house, located in the Llojeta neigborhood on the west side of the city. The incomes received by Juana and her husband permit them to support the family.

The destination of this loan is to invest in merchandise, which will permit Juana to satisfy the demand which exists for her products. In this way she will be able to increase her sales and create some small savings, which she hopes to use to buy a plot of land and build a home of her own.

This is Juana's third loan, and her good record with our organization allows her to request another credit in order to strengthen her commercial activity and in this way to increase her economic income.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Jorge is a public service transporter (taxi driver). He is unmarried, and lives with his three daughters, ages 19, 18, and 7 years. The oldest suffers from a mental illness and for that reason cannot participate in any educational institution. The family lives in the home of Jorge's parents in the Alto Tejar neighborhood of the city of La Paz. The income generated by the taxi permits him to support the family.

The destination of this credit will be the repair (repainting and plating) of his vehicle, which is the tool of his trade and which permits him to work in the whole city of La Paz and El Alto.

This is Jorge's third credit. His good record with our organization allows him to request another loan, which will enable him to keep the tool of his trade in good working condition.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

loans.use: To maintain his vehicle

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.en:
María Eugenia lives in a rented room on Manuel Jofre street in the Tacagua neighborhood, along with her mother, age 60. She is 25 years old, and she works making donuts with the help of her mother. In the afternoons she also sells empanadas on commission, which she buys for 0.40 Bs and sells for 0.50 Bs. This gives her a small profit margin, which is lost if she doesn't sell all her stock daily. For this reason she has decided to start making them herself, in order to earn a bit more.

Upon learning about the existence of IMPRO and our microcredit programs for low-income people, she brought in her application to request a loan with the hope of being a beneficiary, since her income depends entirely on what she can earn.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Early pay off.  Maria Eugenia is applying for a new loan.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina lives in her own home on Nicolas Palma Street in the neighborhood of Sopocachi in La Paz. She is the mother of five, of whom two are in her care. She has been separated from her husband for 12 years. Josefina has a small street stand where she sells candies and cookies for children. In addition, to round out her income she sells prepaid calling cards for Viva and ENTEL. For the small commission she makes on these sales, she must stay open from 8:00 in the morning until 8:00 at night seven days a week. She has been an IMPRO client since 2002 with a track record that supports extending credit to her.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

Josefina vive en casa propia en la calle Nicolás Palma de la zona de Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz; es madre de 5 hijos de los cuales dos están a su cargo, está separada del esposo hace casi 12 años. Josefina tiene un pequeño puesto de venta en la calle donde comercializa dulces, galletas, chocolates, y otras golosinas para niños.. Además para mejorar sus ingresos vende tarjetas prepago de telefonía celular de las empresas Viva y ENTEL por una pequeña comisión lo cual la obliga a trabajar desde las 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 20:00 de la noche, todos los días incluidos los Domingos. Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2002 y por su antecedente histórico se considera factible otorgarle el crédito.

loans.use: To raise working capital

payments.comment:
Early pay off. 
Client will apply for a new loan.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma C. is the single mother of a two-year old who lives in Tacagua, on the west side of La Paz. She works at a copy shop downtown. Her home has no wall around it and is left exposed to thieves while she is away. This loan is to pay for building a wall. This is the second time Emma has turned to IMPRO for credit and she has been a good client. Her employment and credit history with us show that she can improve her income and repay this loan, and they allow her to apply for this credit.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Alexis Hult

Emma C. vive sola, con su hijo de dos años en una vivienda ubicada en la zona de Tacagua, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja como empleada en una oficina de fotocopias en el centro de la ciudad. La vivienda que ocupa, no tiene amurallado, por lo que se expone a que puedan robar sus pertenencias en su ausencia, el crédito solicitado es para la construcción de muro perimetral. Esta es la segunda vez que recurre a Impro para obtener un crédito. Su historial en nuestra institución los clasifica como buen cliente. Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios en nuestra institución le permiten acceder a este crédito, demostrando que pueden mejorar sus ingresos y cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Construction

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria sells clothing and bedspreads. She has no fixed place of business, but sells door to door and in markets and offices, collecting her money each day, what's known here in Bolivia as a runner. She is a 43-year-old widow with two children in school so she is the only earner in her household. She makes sales on request, so if for example a customer asks for a dress, she finds it and sells it on the same day repaying the wholesale purchase and making a profit. She has been doing business this way for ten years and has been a client of IMPRO since 2005 with a first class track record of paying back loans. This credit will be used to buy clothing, bedding and other goods. She can get them at a better price buying in volume and it will also let her show customers the goods in advance. Her record with IMPRO recommends extending her credit as she has experience in this business.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Alexis Hult

Victoria, vende frazadas, abarrotes edredones, ropa, repartiendo en los mercados, oficinas, efectuando la cobranza diariamente, no tiene un puesto fijo ya que es repartidora, actividad que en Bolivia comúnmente se denomina como “corredoras”. Tiene 43 años y dos hijos es la única que genera ingresos en su familia ya que es viuda y sus hijos son estudiantes. Sus ventas son al pedido ya que si alguna persona le pide algún artículo como por ejemplo frazada la señora compra y le entrega para que le cobre diariamente hasta cubrir el monto total más su ganancia. Tiene una experiencia en este tipo de comercio de más de 10 años. Es cliente de Impro desde el 2005, su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento muy bueno de pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de ropa, frazadas, edredones y abarrotes ya que le resulta mas barato comprar en cantidad, además que puede exponer y mostrar a sus clientes sus productos. Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio. El cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anderson

texts.en:
Anderson has a microenterprise dedicated to the distribution of books. He is 40 years old and has 3 children. His wife helps him in the running of his business. He has four employees, who are responsible for marketing, product distribution, and their respective receipts. Anderson has over 10 years of experience in this field. With this business, he generates many jobs both directly and indirectly.

He has been a client of IMPRO since 2004. His history with our organization has qualified him as a #1 client, which is to say that he has complied very well with the repayment of his obligation. The loan he is requesting here will be used to buy books. His work experience makes him confident that with this credit he will obtain an income that will enable him to repay the loan.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Victorine

texts.en: Victorine is 60 years old. She is a widow with seven children and two grandchildren. She has been in business since 1971. After her husband’s death in 1985, she has devoted her life to business. She even taught three of her children in business. Victorine needs a loan of $800 to purchase 80 sacks of corn for resale. By bringing sacks of corn from the rural areas to the urban, she is creating opportunities for the rural population to reach the urban markets with their goods.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of corn in bulk for sale.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Hélène

texts.en: Hélène is 60 years old. She is married and a mother of three children. Hélène started her business in 1997. She produces purified water and provides it to her intermediary clients, who sell it to the population. Due to the high demand of purified water from the community, Hélène needs a loan of $1,000. She wants to buy a generator to have a permanent and stabilized power for consistent production. She also wants to buy two faucets and filters. Hélène is a strong woman dedicated to her business. She wakes up at 1:00 am every morning to work. By producing a lot of purified water, Hélène contributes significantly in the fight against diseases spread through contaminated water in her community.

loans.use: To purchase a generator, faucets, and filters.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Adolphine Yeze

texts.en: Adolphine is 53 years old and married. She has been involved since 1995 in selling women’s clothing and soft drinks. Between 2004 and 2007 she borrowed seven loans from IMF Hope (a Microfinance Institution in DRCongo) for business expansion. Now she applies for $1,000 to buy more women’s clothing and crates of beverages to meet the clients’ high demand in her community. Adolphine wants to increase her sales.

loans.use: To buy women’s clothing and crates of beverages in bulk for resale.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Ali Mandiangu

texts.en: Ali is a single man who was born in 1973. He has been in his computer business since 2002. Ali provides secretarial services to his community. He has five years experience in this business, which is well-located in his area. He is requesting $1,000 to buy a copying machine and spare parts and improve his services to his customers. His dream is to open a computer pieces shop.

loans.use: To purchase a copying machine.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.en:
Ms. Rafaela had been in business for 6 months. "My shop is in a good location but there are lots of things customers come in asking for that I don't have. I have to stock up on a little of everything, so I'm asking for $1000."

Translated by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

La Sra. Rafaela tiene 6 meses con su negocio. “Mi negocio esta en muy buena ubicación pero hay muchas cosas que mis clientes me piden y no tengo, necesito comprar mercancía y tener uno poco de todo”. Solicito 1,000.00 dlls para invertir en mi negocio en la compra de mercancía.

loans.use: To invest in goods for her shop.

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Mrs. Ludivina has had her business for two years. "Across the street from my shop is a kindergarden and many people come in looking for school supplies to buy but I have to turn them away. I'm losing customers. I'm asking for $1000 to buy school supplies to sell in my shop."

Translated by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

La Sra.
