Ludivina tiene 2 años con su negocio. “Enfrente de mi negocio hay un Kinder así es que me gustaría comprar material escolar ya que me lo piden mucho y tengo que decirles que no vendo nada de eso, se me están yendo muchos clientes a compra a otra parte debído a eso” Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para comprar material escolar para vender en mi negocio.

loans.use: To purchase school supplies for resale.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita lives with her two children, Irene and Cristian, who are 15 and 16 years old. They live in the 8th of December zone of the city of La Paz (a low-income neighborhood), and she sells coffee at a kiosk in the city’s bus station. The adobe house where she lives is her own property and has three rooms. The requested loan is for the construction of a wall in front of the house and a better door, because the current door doesn’t provide any security. This is her third loan with IMPRO and her previous good credit history and demonstrated ability to repay makes it possible for her to take out this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Benita, vive con sus dos hijos Irene y Cristian de 15 y 16 años en la zona 8 de Diciembre de la ciudad de La Paz (barrio marginal) y se dedica a la venta de café en un quiosco de la terminal de buses de la ciudad. La vivienda de su propiedad tiene tres habitaciones de adobe y el crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de muro frontal y puerta principal, la misma que ahora es de calamina y no le garantiza protección alguna. Es la tercera vez que tiene crédito en Impro y los antecedentes crediticios le permiten acceder a este crédito, demostrando que pueden cumplir con el préstamo.

loans.use: Necessary improvements to her house

loans.name: Eliseo

texts.en:
Mr. Eliseo worked for a shoe making company for 15 years. When the business had to close and move to another state, Eliseo decided to work independently and start his own shoe repair business because he already had the experience. Now, supporting his three children and his wife motivates him to fight day after day to improve and expand his business.

Currently, Eliseo needs a sewing machine that would make the service he offers to his clients both faster and of better quality. For this reason, he is asking for a $475 loan, which he would repay in 5 to 10 months. Take part in this business’s growth. Eliseo needs your support and appreciates your generosity.

El señor Eliseo trabajaba en una empresa en fabricación de zapatos, durante 15 años se desempeño en esta labor, cuando la empresa tuvo que cerrar y cambiar su domicilio a otro estado, Eliseo decidió independizarse e iniciar su propio negocio de reparación de calzado, en lo que tiene una amplia experiencia, ahora el apoyo de sus tres hijos y de su esposa es lo que lo motiva a luchar día a día por mejorar y hacer crecer su empresa.

En estos momentos, Eliseo necesita de una máquina de coser, que utiliza en la realización de su trabajo, con ésta podría agilizar y mejorar la calidad del servicio que ofrece a sus clientes, con este fin, solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares, que ofrece devolver en un lapso de 5 a 10 meses. Se parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio, Eliseo necesita de tu apoyo y agradece tu generosidad.

loans.use:
Compra de máquina de coser

Purchase of a sewing machine

loans.name: Xochitl Aracely

texts.en:
Xochitl is a married mother of two small children ages 8 and 6, both of whom attend school. Faced with a lack of resources to cover the costs of the home and school, two years ago she decided to start her own grocery business. This activity allows her to care for her children while earning the extra income they need. She wants her children to have a better future and she is working hard so they can have access to a quality education.

At this time, Xochitl needs a loan of $250 to acquire the merchandise needed to offer her customers a greater variety of products, thereby increasing her sales and growing her business. She is offering to repay the loan within 3 to 6 months. You can contribute the growth of this business as well as improve the life of this family. They sincerely appreciate your support.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Xochilt es casada y madre de dos pequeños, de 8 y 6 años de edad, ambos estudian, ante la falta de recursos para solventar los gastos del hogar y de la escuela, desde hace dos años, decidió iniciar su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes, esta actividad le permite cuidar a sus hijos y obtener un ingreso extra que les hacía falta, ella quiere que sus hijos puedan tener un mejor futuro y trabaja arduamente para que ellos tengan acceso a una educación de calidad.

En estos momentos, Xochilt necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder ofrecerles a sus clientes una mayor variedad de productos y de esta manera incrementar las ventas y hacer crecer su negocio, ella ofrece devolverlo en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Tú puedes contribuir al crecimiento de este negocio, así como a mejorar la vida de esta familia, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: Acquire merchandise

loans.name: Griselda

texts.en:
Griselda has been running her restaurant for more than 10 years in her hometown of García, Nuevo León. She has seen her business grow gradually and has had the opportunity to employ various people as business collaborators. Griselda has a daughter in college and wants to help her finish her professional career successfully. Her love for her family and her desire for improvement have motivated her to work harder every day.

At this time, Griselda needs a loan of $925 to stock the restaurant with necessary merchandise. Her efforts and hard work have kept her in business for a long time and she would like her restaurant to continue growing. You can help make this possible by making the decision to help her.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Griselda tiene más de diez años con su restaurante, en la localidad de García, Nuevo León, de donde es originaria. Ella ha visto crecer su negocio poco a poco y ha tenido la oportunidad de emplear a varias personas para que colaboren con ella en su negocio. Griselda tiene una hija que actualmente esta estudiando y quiere apoyarla a concluir con éxito su carrera profesional, el amor a su familia y los deseos de superación la han motivado a esforzarse casa día más.

En estos momentos Griselda necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 925 dólares que empleará para surtir las mercancías que necesita para el restaurante. Su esfuerzo y trabajo la ha mantenido por tanto tiempo en el negocio y quiere que su restaurante continúe creciendo, tú puedes ayudar a que esto sea posible, decídete a ayudarla.

loans.use: Acquire supplies

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.en:
Maria Guadalupe is a native of Garcia, in the state of Nuevo León. She has three children who currently attend school. She was laid off from her job due to personnel cuts. She decided to use her severance pay to start her own business selling fabric and footwear, with the goal of providing for her children's needs and improving her family's quality of life.

Maria would like to allow her business to grow. She now needs a loan of $275 to purchase a copy machine, as she knows that offering this service will increase her sales and achieve greater profitability. You can be a fundamental part of the lives of Maria and her family by helping her in the growth of her business. Don’t hesitate any longer.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria Guadalupe es originaria de García, del estado de Nuevo León, tiene tres hijos, que se encuentran estudiando, ella fue despedida de su trabajo por recorte de personal, con su liquidación ella decidió iniciar su propio negocio, con la venta de mercería y calzado, con el objetivo de dales lo necesario a sus hijos y mejora las calidad de vida de su familia.

Maria desea que su negocio pueda crecer, ahora necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $275 dólares que empleará en la compra de una copiadora, porque sabe que al ofrecer este servicio se incrementaran sus ventas y podrá obtener una mayor utilidad. Tú puedes ser parte fundamental en la vida de Maria y de su familia, apoyándola en el crecimiento de su negocio, no lo pienses más.

loans.use: Acquire merchandise

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.en:
Alejandrina is 48 years of age. She has a 27-year-old son who lives with her. She was never able to count on her son’s father for support and has therefore worked hard to provide for her son’s needs. Although Alejandrina works as a driver in public transportation, for the past seven years she has been running her own jewelry business. She enjoys sales and has been able to earn the extra income she needs to improve her son's and mother's quality of life.

At this time, Alejandrina is in need of a loan of $475 to acquire the merchandise needed to offer a greater selection to her customers and thereby increase sales. She would like to see her business grow and is working hard to achieve this. You can help make her dream come true.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Alejandrina tiene 48 años de edad, tiene un hijo de 27 años que vive con ella, nunca contó con el apoyo del padre de su hijo por lo que ha trabajado mucho para poder darle lo necesario. Aunque Alejandrina trabaja como chofer en un transporte público, hace siete años tiene su propio negocio de venta de joyería, a ella le gustan las ventas y de esta manera ha podido obtener un ingreso extra que le permita mejorar la calidad de vida de su hijo y de su madre.

En estos momentos Alejandrina necesita de un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía que le permita tener una mayor variedad que ofrecerle a sus clientes y así incrementar las ventas. Ella desea ver crecer su negocio y se esfuerza para lograrlo, tú puedes ayudarla, contribuye a la realización de este sueño, tú puedes hacerlo.

loans.use: Acquire merchandise

loans.name: Caya

texts.en:
In December of 2000, Caya started her own grocery business. She is 42 and a married mother of a 24-year-old son and a 20-year-old daughter. Caya noticed that there were no stores in her neighborhood and thought it would be a good business opportunity. She therefore decided to open a grocery shop and she has done quite well. The business has been growing gradually and she has been able to help her husband cover the costs of the home and her children’s schooling.

Caya is now in need of a loan of $925 to acquire merchandise for a better selection in her shop and to purchase a larger refrigerator in order to better serve her customers. You can contribute the growth of this business as well as improve the life of this family. They sincerely appreciate your support.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

El diciembre del 2000, Caya inició su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes, ella tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y madre de un hijo de 24 años y una hija de 20. Caya se dio cuenta que por la colonia donde vive no había tiendas y pensó que era una buena oportunidad de negocio, así que se decidió a abrir un abarrote y le fue muy bien, poco a poco ha ido creciendo, de esta manera puede ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar y la escuela de sus hijos.

Ahora Caya necesita de un crédito por $925 que empleará en al compra de mercancía para tener mejor surtido su negocio y comprar un enfriador más grande, para poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Tú puedes ser parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio y ayudar a mejorar la vida de esta familia, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: Acquire merchandise

loans.name: Mil

texts.en: Mil C. is 60 years old and lives with her six children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  Unfortunately, her husband recently passed away, leaving the family in a difficult economic situation.  C. runs a grocery store and can typically make about five dollars per day.  Three of her children help contribute to the family by working in a garment factory--each making $60 per month.  Her other three children are still students.  C. hopes to use this loan to buy sugar cane in order to expand her grocery business.  In the future, Mil C. would like to send her children to university and build a new house with a garden and gate.

loans.use: To buy sugar cane to expand grocery business

payments.comment:
Dear Kiva Lender,

Great news! Mil Chaoeun has repaid the Kiva loan early! Kiva and CREDIT MFI make every effort to be as transparent as possible so you can trust the information we give you. In this case, we didn’t let you know that the loan had been repaid at the time. Occasionally, when a loan is repaid early, the payment schedule posted on Kiva doesn’t always match the records of our micro finance partner in Cambodia, CREDIT MFI. As in life, the system doesn’t always run perfectly, but when there is a discrepancy we will alert you as soon as possible so you have all the information about your investment.

On the upside, the issue occurred because the client’s business is so successful! Your loan made that possible. Soon you will see a repayment posted on the client’s profile that is larger than the usual amount. This will end the loan and return the funds to your account. We hope you will choose to loan the repaid funds to another entrepreneur who would a like a chance to grow their business as well. 

If you have any questions, please post them as a comment on this borrowers site and I will be happy to respond. I also encourage you to write comments on the pages of your loan recipients so we can pass along your good wishes to the borrowers.

We sincerely apologize for the oversight and are putting policies in place to make sure that it doesn’t happen again. Thank you for giving poor entrepreneurs in Cambodia a chance at success! 

Best regards,

Sopheap Khiev, Kiva partnership coordinator, Cambodia
Mr. Chan Mach, General Manager, CREDIT MFI, Cambodia

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch S. is a 56 year old woman living in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. As a widow, S. raises her five children alone making five dollars a day selling groceries. Two of her children contribute to the family's income as moto taxi drivers each making $100 per month. Two other children work in garment factories each making $60 per month. S. plans to use the loan to buy more groceries and expand her store. In the future she hopes to build a new home for her family.

loans.use: To expand grocery store

loans.name: Le

texts.en: Le and her husband were born in 1972. They have two daughters, 16 and 14. The eldest daughter has stopped attending school, and the youngest is an eighth grade student. They have a little land for their hut and a pigpen. They earn about $10 per person per month from making baskets and raising pigs. They are requesting a loan of $75 dollars in order to raise more pigs and make more baskets. This will increase their income and standard of living.

loans.use: Materials needed for making baskets and raising pigs

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor works in selling supplies in the market to the south of the city. She started her business with a small amount of capital that her parents helped her with. She started selling vegetables. Now she continues selling these same products, along with other goods like sugar, rice, etc.

Leonor will use the loan to invest in buying more merchandise which will lead to having better income. She is confident that her business will grow. Leonor is 54 years old and has three children. She hopes that with this loan, she will improve her family's quality of life and this will allow her to save to give her children a better education.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Leonor se dedica a la venta de víveres en el mercado al sur de la ciudad. Empezó su negocio con un pequeño capital que le facilitaron sus padres. Se inicio vendiendo legumbres y verduras. Ahora ella continúa vendiendo estos mismos productos junto con los demás víveres como azúcar, arroz etc. Leonor usara el préstamo para invertir en comprar mercadería al por mayor y así poder tener mejores ingresos. Ella tiene la confianza que su negocio crecerá. Leonor tiene 54 años, esta unida tiene tres hijos. Ella tiene la esperanza que con este préstamo mejorara la calidad de vida de su familia y le permitirá ahorrar para darles una mejor educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Invest in merchandise for her market

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos sells small electric domestic applianes in urban zones. Carlos began his business through a loan of $100.00. At the beginning he only sold plastics door to door. Now he offers the same service but also electric devices. His ambition is to adapt his home to a place where he can display his products. He is very sure that his customers will be happier with this new service and that their numbers will grow.Carlos is married. He is 38 and has 3 children, 2 who are in school. He is convinced that this loan will improve the economic situation of his family and his business will continue to grow so that he can save and give a better education to his children.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Carlos vende pequeños electrodomésticos en zonas urbanas. Carlos empezó su negocio prestando la cantidad de 100 dólares a su cuñado. Al principio solo se dedicaba a la venta de plásticos puerta a puerta. Ahora ofrece este mismo servicio junto con pequeños electrodomésticos. El aspira adecuar en su vivienda un local para exhibir la mercadería. El tiene la plena seguridad que con este nuevo servicio sus clientes se sentirán contentos y va ha tener crecimiento. Carlos esta unido. Tiene 38 años tiene tres hijos dos de ellos estudian. El esta convencido que con este préstamo mejorara el nivel económico de su familia y seguirá creciendo en el negocio para ahorrar y darles una mejor educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Adapt his home to his business

loans.name: Ciria

texts.en:
Ciria works selling clothing in the provinces of her neighbohood and to friends. Ciria began her business with the help of her sister who loaned her the merchandise to begin her own business. At the beginning she only sold underwear. Now she sells all types of clothing. Ciria hopes to also sell toys and to earn higher profits so that her business can grow. She would use her loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise and by which turn highe profits. Ciria is single. She is 50 and she depends on her business to support her family and to save for the future.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Ciria se dedica a la venta de ropa en provincias, por su sector y amistades. Ciria empezó su negocio con la ayuda de su hermana quien le facilito la mercadería para que emprendiera su propio negocio. Al principio solo vendía ropa interior. Ahora vende toda clase de ropa. Ciria aspira vender juguetes y obtener mayores ingresos para que su negocio tenga crecimiento. Ella usara el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería al por mayor y así obtener mejores ganancias. Ciria esta soltera. Ella tiene 50 años, depende de su negocio para apoyar a su familia y ahorrar para el futuro.

loans.use: Invest in toys.

loans.name: Mártin

texts.en:
Mártir has two encebollado stores, and his wife works at one of them. He started his business with the help of a loan that he requested from the loan sharks. At the beginning, he only sold encebollados (onion dish). Now he also sells guatita (typical Ecuadorean peanut dish).

Mártir hopes to grow his business and be able to be an example to other people. He will use the loan to invest in buying an industrial cooker and kitchen utensils.

He has faith that with this new service, his business will grow and its economic stability will improve. He is married and has six children. He is 39 years old and depends only on his business to maintain his household. Mártir is sure that this loan will provide him security and allow him to save for his children's education.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Mártir tiene dos puntos de encebollados uno atiende su esposa. Empezó su negocio con la ayuda de un préstamo que solicito a los churqueros. Al principio solo vendía encebollados. Ahora también vende encebollados y guatita. Mártir aspira crecer en su negocio y poder dar empleo a otras personas. El usara el préstamo para invertir en comprar una cocina industrial y utensilios de cocina. El tiene la fe que con este nuevo servicio su negocio crecerá y su estabilidad económica mejorara. El esta unido tiene seis hijos. Tiene 39 años el depende solo de su negocio para el sustento de su hogar. Mártir esta seguro que este préstamo le dará seguridad y le permitirá ahorrar para la educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy a used industrial cooker

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio makes backpacks. He began his business after seeing the need to employ himself after being left jobless. At the beginning he made the backpacks by hand and selling them to friends and through his neighborhood. Now he sells the same product as well as school suppplies. He would use the loan to invest in material and to buy an industrial machine so that he could increase his earnings. He has faith that with this loan he will be able to improve his quality of living and will be able to help his business grow. Antonio is 30, married and has 3 children. He is sure that with this loan he will be able to improve his quality of life and be able to save for the future.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Antonio se dedica a la elaboración de mochilas (backpacks). Antonio empezó su negocio viendo la necesidad que tenia ya que se encontraba desempleado. Al principio confeccionaba las mochilas a mano vendiéndolas a sus amistades y por el sector. Ahora vende este mismo producto junto con útiles escolares. El usara este préstamo para invertir en material y poder comprar una maquina industrial y así obtener mejores ingresos. El tiene la fe que con este préstamo mejorara su calidad de vida y tendrá crecimiento en su negocio. Antonio tiene 30 años esta unido y tiene tres hijos el esta seguro que con este préstamo mejorara su calidad de vida y podrá ahorrar para el futuro.

loans.use: To purchase an industrial machine

loans.name: Proak

texts.en: Proak S. is 37 years and lives with her husband and three children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  S. sells rice and traditional Khmer food at a food stand outside her house and can make about $7 on an average day.  Her husband is a tuk-tuk (a passenger carriage attached to a motorcycle) driver and can also make about $7 per day (not including costs of gas and renting the tuk-tuk).  The family hopes to use this loan to purchase a tuk-tuk so that S.'s husband no longer has to pay rental fees.  In the future, the couple hopes to send their three children to university.  Also, they hope to repair their house to make it stronger for the rainy season.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle tuk-tuk to drive passengers

loans.name: Ginger

texts.en:
Ginger sells clothing and bookbags door to door in the north of the city. Ginger began her business with the help of her ex-husband who loaned her $100.00 to start her business. At the start she only sold clothing for women and children. Now she continues to sell these items along with men's clothing. Ginger wishes to also sell electric domestic devices that her current customers ask for. She has faith that this new product would help her business grow. She is separated and has 2 children in school. She is 37. Ginger depends on her business to completely support her children's education. Ginger is confident that his loan will allow her to save for the future.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Ginger se dedica a la venta de ropa y mochilas puerta a puerta al norte de la ciudad. Ginger empezó su negocio con la ayuda de su ex esposo quien le facilito 100 dólares para que emprendiera su negocio. Al principio solo vendía ropa para niños y damas. Ahora sigue vendiendo este producto junto con ropa de caballeros. Ginger aspira vender pequeños electrodomésticos que le solicitan sus clientes. Ella tiene fe que con este nuevo producto su negocio crecerá. Ella esta separada de su esposo tiene dos hijos que estudian. Ella tiene 37 años. Ginger depende de su negocio completamente para apoyar a la educación de sus hijos. Ginger tiene la confianza que este préstamo le permitirá ahorrar para el futuro.

loans.use: Invest in electronic domestic devices.

loans.name: Freddy

texts.en:
Freddy has a store and a bazar in his home. He began his business with a liquidation that his previous employer gave him. At the start he only sold rice, sugar and beans. Now he sells these along with other general items. He would use his loan to purchase a refridgerator and display windows so that he could be more competitive in the market and have higher earnings. He has faith that with these new products his business will grow and he will have a stable income. Freddy is married and is 45. He is sure this loan will give him security and will allow him to save for the future.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Freddy tiene una tienda y bazar en su domicilio. Empezó su negocio con una liquidación que le dieron donde trabajo anteriormente. Al principio solo vendía arroz, azúcar y fréjoles. Ahora vende este mismo producto junto con artículos de generales. El usara el préstamo para invertir en comprar un congelador y vitrinas y así ser más competitivos en el mercado y poder tener mejores ganancias. El tiene la fe que con este nuevo producto su negocio crecerá y tendrá estabilidad económica. Freddy esta esta unido. Tiene 45 años, esta seguro que este préstamo le dará seguridad y le permitirá ahorrar para el futuro.

loans.use: Refridgerator and glass windows.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen sells various items. She began her business with the support of her sister, who loaned her $200.00. At the start, she only sold school items. Now she continues to offer these, as well as clothing and gifts. Carmen also wishes to sell cosmetics and jewelry. She would use her loan to purchase in these items while they are on sale so that she could make higher returns on sales. She has faith that with these new products, her business will grow and she will be able to continue to invest in merchandise. Carmen is separated and has one son. She is convinced that her business will grow and will allow her to save for the future.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Carmen se dedica a la venta de artículos varios. Carmen empezó su negocio con el apoyo de su hermana quien le facitilo la cantidad de 200 dólares .Al principio solo vendia útiles escolares. Ahora continúa ofreciendo estos productos juntos con ropa y regalos. Carmen aspira vender bisutería y cosméticos .Ella usara el prestamo para invertir en comprar mercadería en ofertas para así obtener mejores ganancias. Ella tiene fe que con estos nuevos productos su negocio crecera y le permitira seguir invirtiendo en mercaderia. Carmen esta separada tiene un hijo. Esta convencida que su negocio crecerá y le permitirá ahorrar para el futuro.

loans.use: To invest in cosmetics and jewelry.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia has 7 years experience and knowledge in producing ceramic items such as: souvenirs for marriages, quinceaneras, baptisms, graduation and other events. She learned these skills from a friend. Cecilia considers herself to be an enterprising woman who sees a lucrative business behind this art and so decided to open a small shop. Cecilia placed a small workshop in her home and for 5 years, with her friend's help, has sold some models and with her savings she bought the necessary prime materials to begin her business. Cecilia is well known in her neighborhood and friends from within and outside her neighborhood ask for her to take a commission from them. Cecilia sees customers between 7am and 8pm.

Cecilia is asking for a loan in order to expand her business because her demand has increased and she would also like to remodel her store in order to give a better impression to customers.

Cecilia is a hard working person, she is 40 years old and has 2 children, sho says she needs this loan in order to strenghten her business since the lack of capital has held her back from completing certain commissions, where the investment in prime materials is great. Furthermore, she states that investing more would generate higher profits thus giving a better life to her family as well as food, education and safety.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Cecilia tiene 7 años de experiencia en conocer y producir productos de cerámica. Como: recuerdos de matrimonios, quinceañeras, bautizos, graduaciones y otros. Cecilia aprendió en taller de cerámica de amiga. Cecilia se considera una persona emprendedora por lo que vio en este arte una fuente de ingreso y decido ser una microempresaria. Cecilia puso en su domicilio su pequeño taller y desde hace 5 años con ayuda de su amiga que le vendió ciertos moldes y con ahorro de ella compro la materia prima necesaria para dar inicio a su negocio. Cecilia como era conocida en su sector sus amigos dentro y fuera del sector le hacen pedidos. Cecilia atiende a su clientela desde la 7 AM a 20PM

Cecilia solicita préstamo para incrementar su negocio debido a que su demanda ha crecido y también quiere readecuar su local para dar una mejor imagen a sus clientes

Cecilia es una persona trabajadora tiene 40 años y 2 hijos indica que necesita crédito para de esta manera seguir fortaleciendo su negocio ya que la falta de capital no le permite cumplir con ciertos pedidos donde la inversión en materia prima es mayor. Además ella indica que invirtiendo mas generaría mas ingresos adicionales y daría mejor bienestar a su familia tanto en alimentación, educación y seguridad a su hogar .

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel has run a confectionary and yogurt store from her home for 5 years. She began this activity with savings and a small loan. Her husband and children help her tend to customers between 6am and 8pm at night.

Marbiel has indicated that with a loan she can buy between 2-4 liters of yogurt and confectionary items. It is now the school year and mothers use the yogurts to pack in school lunches. Maribel also knows that the investment will allow her to earn higher profits to contribute to her family and will also be able to meet her customers' demands.

Maribel is 39 and married with 4 children, who help her along with her husband in her activity. Her husbands says he is happy with his wife and considers her a hard working woman who looks after the well-being of the family.Maribel is confident that the additional earnings will help her to continue making additions to her home, which will provide her children with added security.

Translated by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor, from Spanish.

Maribel tiene negocio de venta de confites y yogurt en su domicilio desde hace 5 años. Se inicio en esta actividad con ahorro y un préstamo pequeño. Su esposo e hijos la apoyan en su negocio con la a atención al publico desde la 6AM a 20PM.

Maribel indica que con el préstamo comprara mas yogurt de 2 y 4 litros y confites. Es época escolar y las madres de familias lo utilizan para el lunch de sus hijos. Maribel además sabe que incrementando su negocio sus ventas también se suben y a su vez generara mas ingresos para la familia y cumplirá con la demanda de sus clientes

Maribel es casada tiene 39 años, 4 hijos su esposo la apoya al igual que sus hijos en su negocio. Su esposo indica que esta contento con su esposa ya que la considera una persona trabajadora que busca el bienestar de su familia. Maribel tiene la confianza que con la generación de estos ingresos ayudara en seguir adecuando su vivienda y así dar una mejor seguridad a su hijos.

loans.use: To purchase yogurts.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en:
Pablo has 20 years of experience in furniture making. He started his own business 15 years ago. His carpentry workshop is located in his home. His products, more specifically, include wardrobes, shelves and other items his customers request. His wife and his children help him in his business, and they help clients from 7 AM to 6 PM.

Pablo will use the loan to buy wood, glue, sealant, sandpaper, solvant and other supplies needed to meet customers' requests. Pablo is really well known in his area and people always look for him because he finishes his work on time.

Pablo is 39 years old, married, and has 4 children. Pablo and his wife work hard every day to succeed with their workshop in order to be able to give their children better food and a good education. Pablo also hopes that the revenue generated from his new investment will allow him to keep adapting his home to suit his shop's needs.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer

Pablo tiene experiencia en ebanistería desde hace 20 años en trabajos que realizo con familiares que tenían este oficio. Se inicio con su negocio desde hace 15 años. Su taller de ebanistería esta ubicado en su domicilio. Sus productos a elaborar son las cómodas, anaqueles y otros artículos que sus clientes le soliciten. En su negocio lo apoyan su esposa e hijos y dan atención a sus clientes desde las 7AM a 18PM

Pablo utilizara su crédito en la compra de maderas, goma, sellador, lijas, diluyente y otros para así cumplir con su clientela. Pablo es muy conocido en su sector y siempre lo buscan por lo que cumple con su trabajo a tiempo.

Pablo es casado tiene 39 años y 4 hijos menores de edad. Pablo junto con su esposa se esfuerzan día a día para seguir adelante con su taller y así poder contar con sus ingresos y darles una mejor alimentación y educación a su familia. Pablo también anhela que con los ingresos obtenidos generados con esta nueva inversión podrá seguir adecuando su vivienda.

loans.use: Carpentry Material

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet sells various items for the home. She sells cosmetics, perfume, schoolbags, shoes and other items requested by her customers. She has run her business from her home for 8 years. In the afternoons she also goes and sells her merchandise from door to door. She attends clients from 7 AM to 10 PM and goes from door to door from 3 PM to 7 PM in the evening.

Janet is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of school supplies her clients are currently requesting because school is in session.

Janet is 38 years old, married, and has two children, both of whom are studying. Janet considers herself a hardworking woman who is looking for a way to increase revenues in order to be able to support her children. She is confident that she will be able to succeed with the loan and thus meet her goals, which are to continue to educate her children and improve their lifestyle.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Janet tiene negocio de venta de artículos varios para el hogar. Vende cosméticos, perfumes, mochilas escolares, zapatos y otros artículos que el cliente le solicite. Tiene su negocio desde hace 8 años en su domicilio. Janet por las tardes también recorre su mercadería de casa en casa. Su atención a los clientes en la mañana es desde 7AM a 10pm y en las tardes sale a las 15PM a 19PM

Janet solicita su crédito para invertir en compra de listas de útiles escolares que por ser la época de estudios sus clientes les están haciendo pedidos y no desea fallarles porque saben que ella les da tiempo para cancelarlas.

Janet es casada tiene 38 años y 2 hijos menores de edad que están estudiando. Janet se considera una mujer trabajadora que busca la forma de generar otros ingresos y así poder cumplir con las necesidades de sus hijos. Además ella tiene la plena confianza que saldrá adelante con el préstamo, por que tiene un propósito que cumplir que es seguir educando a sus hijos y mejorar su vivienda.

loans.use: Investment in School Supplies

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco has had a small furniture making workshop in his home for 3 years and has 20 years of experience in the profession. More specifically, Francisco learned about making and decorating coffins because he worked in well-known funeral homes in the city. With his own money from his savings, he started his business. First, Francisco buys blank coffins; then, with his wife, he finishes and sells them. Francisco offers his products to the funeral homes at which he worked and is successful there because they know that he works very responsibly.

Francisco will use the loan to purchase blank coffins, cloth, thread, lace, solvent and other items so that he can meet the needs of his customers both inside the city and outside it, now that people are recommending him because of his good work.

Francisco is 43 years old and has a daughter. His wife supports him a lot in his business and is in charge of putting designs into the cloth that goes in the bottom of the coffins. Francisco is confident that his investment will help him provide for his customers and thus increase revenues, which will allow him to improve his house.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer

Francisco tiene pequeño taller de ebanistería en su domicilio desde hace 3 años y experiencia en el arte 20 años. Francisco adquirió conocimiento de acabados y encofrados de cofres mortuorios porque trabajo en funerarias conocidas de la ciudad. Francisco con capital propio producto de sus ahorros se inicio en el negocio de compra de ataúdes en blanco. Francisco junto con su esposa le dan al producto el acabado necesario tanto en laquear y tapizado para poner en ventas sus ataúdes ya terminados. Francisco ofrece sus productos a las funerarias donde trabajo y tiene aceptación por que lo conocen y saben que trabaja con mucha responsabilidad.

Francisco utilizara su crédito en la compra de ataúdes en blanco, tela espejo, hilos, encajes, diluyente y otros para así cumplir con su clientela no solo dentro de la ciudad sino fuera de la misma ya que lo están recomendando por su buen acabado en los cofres.

Francisco tiene 43 años y 1 hija su esposa lo apoya mucho en su negocio ella es la encargada de realizar los nidos de abeja en la tela espejo que es el tapizado del cofre. Además Francisco confía en que su inversión lo ayudara a cumplir con sus clientes y también a incrementar sus ingresos para así poder adecuar su vivienda que es de caña.

loans.use: Purchase of Carpentry Supplies

loans.name: Jesús

texts.en:
Jesús has two years' experience. She worked at home doing domestic tasks. She has decided on her own to go to business for herself. She has learned her trade of sewing on her own. What's motivated her with her savings is that she needed to buy a sewing machine. With it, she makes sheets and then goes out to sell them. She works every day from 8 am until after 4 pm.

Jesús would like credit to buy more fabric, since she has a lot of orders for sheets. In addition, with the greater income, she would like to buy another machine to continue working and make her products with better quality.

Jesús is a single mother. She lives with two grandchildren who are in school. She takes care of them since their mothers work. Her wish is to be able to obtain greater income from the investment she will make with the credit. In addition to improving her home, which is currently made from sugar cane, little by little.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Jesús tiene ya una experiencia de 2 años. Trabajaba en casa realizando quehaceres domésticos. Decide poner su propio negocio por iniciativa propia. Solamente viendo ella aprendió el oficio de la costura. Lo que la motivo a ella para con sus ahorros que tenia comprarse una maquina de coser. Con la que elabora sabanas y luego sale a vender. Trabaja todos los días de la semana desde las 8 a.m. hasta pasadas las 4 p.m.

La señora Jesús desea el crédito para comprar telas por mayor ya que tiene pedidos bastantes de sabanas. Además desea con los ingresos que mejoren poder comprarse otra maquina para seguir trabajando y darle una mejor calidad a sus productos. /p>

Jesús es madre soltera. Vive con dos nietos los que estudian. Ella los tiene a su cargo ya que sus madres trabajan. Su deseo es poder obtener mejores ingresos debido a la inversión que va a realizar con el crédito. Además de adecuar su domicilio poco a poco ya que actualmente es de caña.

loans.use: Buy more fabric

loans.name: Floriano

texts.en:
Floriano has 10 years' experience with his business, selling various goods in the suburban streets. He first worked selling kitchen utensils which were not yet sold by the competition. His strength at this point is sales of cases for remote controls, cell phones, tv antennas, tv controllers and other accessories for electronic articles. He works every day of the week from 8 am to 6 pm. He always rests one day of the week, since his business is walking.

Floriano would like this credit to invest in other products that he doesn't sell due to lack of capital. He would also like to include baby's clothes in his sales.

Floriano is married. He has 4 children who live with him. One of them works and helps him with home expenses. His wife also works, doing domestic tasks for a family. His wish is to be able to improve his income to give a better education and nutrition to his children.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Floriano tiene una experiencia de 10 años con su negocio de venta de artículos varios recorriendo las calles del suburbio. Se dedicaba primero a vender utensilios de cocina los que ya no vende por la competencia. Su fuerte en este momento es la venta de estuches de control remoto, de celulares, antenas de televisión, controles de televisores y demás accesorios de artículos eléctricos. Trabaja todos los días de la semana desde las 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. Siempre descansa un día a la semana ya que su negocio es caminar.

Floriano desea el crédito para invertir en otros productos que no los tiene a la venta por falta de capital. Desea también incluir ropita de bebe en sus ventas. /p>

Floriano es casado. Tiene 4 hijos los que viven con el. Uno de ellos ya trabaja y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Su esposa también trabaja realizando quehaceres domésticos para una familia. Su deseo es poder mejorar sus ingresos para darles una mejor educación y alimentación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Invest in products to sell

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William has been selling his fruit for 5 years. He started out selling candies, which he left because the income was low. Currently, his work consists of getting on public transportation in the city to sell his fruits to the bus passengers and also by walking with his products. He works every day of the week from 8 am to 6 pm.

William would like this credit to be able to supply his business with another type of fruit and, in the future, also transfer it to his home where his wife works.

William is married. He has two children. His wife at this time is not working, since she recently had a baby who is 1 month old. Once she is back to normal, she will start to work selling clothes, which is what she has always done. With the investment he will make, he hopes to be able to finish building his house. He hopes to be able to fill it in, and little by little, make it cement.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

William lleva vendiendo sus frutas 5 años. Se inicio con la venta de confites los que dejo por que la rentabilidad era baja. Actualmente su trabajo consiste en subirse a las líneas de transporte de carros de la ciudad para vender sus frutas a los pasajeros del bus y también lo hace caminando para ofrecer sus productos. Trabaja todos los días de la semana desde las 8 a.m. hasta las 6pm.

William desea el crédito para poder surtir su negocio con otra clase de frutas y en un futuro este negocio también trasladarlo a su domicilio en donde su esposa lo trabaje. /p>

William es casado. Tiene dos hijos. Su esposa al momento no esta trabajando ya que recién dio a luz un bebe que tiene 1 mes de nacido. Una vez normalizado su estado ella comenzara a trabajar vendiendo ropa que es lo que ha hecho siempre. Con la inversión que realizara espera poder terminar de construir su casita la que esta en el agua. Espera poder rellenarla y poco a poco irla haciendo de cemento.

loans.use: Buy more variety of fruit

loans.name: Phen

texts.en: Phen R. is a 44-year-old widow who lives in Phnom Penh.  She has 5 children, 4 of whom work at a private company and 1 who is a full time student.  R. currently rents out 1 small home and earns  $3/day.  R. would like to earn more income so that she can continue supporting her 2 nephews and 2 nieces that live with her and her children.  She will use this loan to repair a home for rental in hopes of doubling her income.  In the future, she would like to continue this business and possibly rent out a third home.  If successful, she would like to send her children to study at university.

loans.use: To repair a house for rental

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en: Tuy T. is 26 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their 2 young children.  Tuy T. rents a home and earns $2/day, while her husband rents cars and earns $17/day.  Tuy T. will use this loan so that her family can own another car to rent out.  As her husband's business continues to grow, their family would like to keep purchasing cars for rental and eventual sale.  T. is confident that she will be able to send her children to university, and she hopes one day they can build a brand new home.

loans.use: To buy a car for daily rental

loans.name: Nang

texts.en: Nang S. is 37 years old and works as a mototaxi driver in Phnom Penh.  He earns about $3/day, and he also helps his wife (pictured here) selling pork products.  He has three young children that go to schoool.  S. will use this loan to buy a stall at the market so he and his wife no longer have to rent one monthly. In the long run, owning the stall will be far cheaper than renting, and his wife plans to work in the market for years to come.  S. hopes the pork-selling business continues to grow so that he can build a new home and send his children to university.

loans.use: To buy a stall at the market to sell pork

loans.name: Oum

texts.en: Oum D., 36 years old, is a construction worker and the father of two children.  He lives with his wife and children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  As a construction worker, D. can typically make about $5 per day, while his wife runs the family's grocery store and can make about $6 per day.  With the loan, the family hopes to buy more grocery items in order to expand the family business.  In the future, D. hopes to further expand the business and also to send his two children to university.

loans.use: To expand grocery business

loans.name: Vong

texts.en: Vong S. is a 45-year-old widow who lives in Phnom Penh with her four children.  Two of her children work at a small private company and earn $240/month combined.  S. sells sno-cones (incredibly delicious on a hot day!) along the street in Phnom Penh.  She will use this loan to buy a new machine because there is such high demand for her treats!  In the future, S. would like to build a new home for her family.

loans.use: To buy a new sno-cone machine

loans.name: Chhoeun

texts.en: Chhoeun R. N. is 33 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  She runs a small grocery store in her village and can make about $2.50 per day.  Her husband is an electrician and can make about $3.50 in a day.  R. N. hopes to use this loan to expand her grocery business by purchasing more products to sell.  In the future, R. N. hopes to generate enough money from her grocery business to send her two children to university.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products to expand business

loans.name: Oksa

texts.en: Oksa V. is 49 years old and owns a small foodstall selling rice porridge and coffee.  She lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their 4 children.  Her husband works at a small private company and earns $4/day.  V. will use this loan to repair their home before they sell it.

loans.use: To repair home for sale

loans.name: Hak

texts.en: Hak B. sells motor oil and owns a small shop that fixes motorbikes and automobiles.  She is 50 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their 5 children.  Her husband is a policeman and earns $5/day, and 3 of her children work and earn $300/month total.  B. will use this loan to buy oil and tools for her shop.  In the future, she would like to make the repair component of her business bigger so that she can earn enough to send her children to university.

loans.use: To buy motor oil for her shop

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Sim S. is 51 years old and is seeking a loan so that he can repair his home before the rainy season.  S. works in construction and earns $7/day, while his wife (pictured here) earns $1/day as a tailor.  One of their children also works and contributes to the house's costs.  When the rainy season hits, S. is worried that his house will leak, and it will ruin many of their possessions. With this loan, he and his family will be able to fix their house so they are ready for the rainy season.

loans.use: to repair home in order to prevent leaking during the rainy season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She is a tailor and needs to buy a motorcycle to transport her clothes to the local market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new mototaxi

loans.name: Touch`

texts.en: Touch S. is 50 years old and lives with her four children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  Unfortunately, her husband passed away and she was left to provide for the family herself.  S. sells traditional Khmer cakes in her village and typically makes about $2.50 per day.  Two of her children work at a nearby garment factory and another works at a private company.  Her fourth child helps S. to sell cakes.  She hopes to use this loan to construct a house for the family, since they are currently living in a small cottage which has leaves as its roof.  In the future S. hopes that her children will complete high school.

loans.use: To build a house

loans.name: Laghn

texts.en: Laghn S. is 47 years old and lives with his wife and six children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  S. and his wife sell cosmetic products to factory workers in their village.  Two of their children are garment factory workers and the other four attend school, but they help their parents with the family business when not at school.  S. and his wife hope to use part of the loan to expand their business and the remainder to repair their house to protect it from leaking during the rainy season.  In the future, S. hopes to expand his business and open a stall at the nearby market.  Also, he hopes to some day build a house to rent to the garment workers in his village.

loans.use: To expand business by purchasing more cosmetics products

loans.name: Pech

texts.en: Pech H. is 35 years old and works in a casino earning $6.30/day.  His wife (pictured here because H. was unavailable) does the same, and she also is a tailor in her extra time.  Hov and his wife have 1 daughter that has learned her mother's skills and helps with her tailoring projects.  H. will use this loan to buy 4 sewing machines for his wife and daughter.  They plan on starting a business to rent out the sewing machines and teach people how to use them so they can eventually work in the garment factory.  In the future, they would like to hire some employees themselves and start a small garment company.

loans.use: To buy four sewing machines

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea S. is a 34 year old widow with three children.  She works very hard as a tailor and earns $7.30/day.  Her children are all students and she spends a lot of time away from her business taking them to school.  It is too expensive for her to pay for them each to get a mototaxi everyday, so she would like to use this loan to buy them a motobike.  This way, S. can work longer hours and she will not have to pay for her children's transportion daily.  She hopes that her children will attend university in the future.

loans.use: To buy motorbike for children's transportation

payments.comment:
Dear Kiva Lender,

Great news! Chea Sareth has repaid the Kiva loan early! Kiva and CREDIT MFI make every effort to be as transparent as possible so you can trust the information we give you. In this case, we didn’t let you know that the loan had been repaid at the time. Occasionally, when a loan is repaid early, the payment schedule posted on Kiva doesn’t always match the records of our micro finance partner in Cambodia, CREDIT MFI. As in life, the system doesn’t always run perfectly, but when there is a discrepancy we will alert you as soon as possible so you have all the information about your investment.

On the upside, the issue occurred because the client’s business is so successful! Your loan made that possible. Soon you will see a repayment posted on the client’s profile that is larger than the usual amount. This will end the loan and return the funds to your account. We hope you will choose to loan the repaid funds to another entrepreneur who would a like a chance to grow their business as well. 

If you have any questions, please post them as a comment on this borrowers site and I will be happy to respond. I also encourage you to write comments on the pages of your loan recipients so we can pass along your good wishes to the borrowers.

We sincerely apologize for the oversight and are putting policies in place to make sure that it doesn’t happen again. Thank you for giving poor entrepreneurs in Cambodia a chance at success! 

Best regards,

Sopheap Khiev, Kiva partnership coordinator, Cambodia
Mr. Chan Mach, General Manager, CREDIT MFI, Cambodia

loans.name: Khiev

texts.en: Khiev S. E. is 25 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  S. E. stays home to watch over her two young children, while her husband is self-employed as a photographer.  Her husband can typically generate about $5 per day from his photography business.  They hope to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle for S. E.'s husband to go to and from work.  In the future, S. E. hopes to open a photograph shop where she will sell her husband's pictures.  Eventually, she hopes that she will be able to send her children to university.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle taxi to get to and from work

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: Thy P. and her husband live with their child and two nephews in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  Both P., who is 26 years old, and her husband work as blacksmiths and can make about $10 on an average day.  She hopes to use this loan to purchase iron tools for her business.  In the future, the couple hopes to expand their business and hire another worker.  They also would like to eventually build a new house and send their child to university.

loans.use: To purchase tools for her job as a blacksmith

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy motorbike for transportation

loans.name: Norng

texts.en: Norng S. is 35 years old and lives with his wife (pictured here because S. was unavailable) and three children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  He works as a moto-taxi driver and typically makes about $5 per day (excluding costs of gas).  His wife runs the family grocery business and can usually generate about $3 in profit per day.  S. hopes to use part of this loan to repair his moto-bike.  With the remainder of the loan, the family will purchase more grocery items to sell at their store.  In the future, S. and his wife hope to repair the family's house and also to send their children to the local school.

loans.use: To expand business by purchasing more grocery items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Margaret would like to buy animal Feeds for Her Dairy Cows and 300 chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to buy a dairy cow and animal feeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sarah would like to buy 300 chickens and buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa is married with a 14-year-old son. She started out as an entrepreneur selling shoes in the busiest city market in Zaporozhye. She had to make frequent trips to remote wholesale centers to purchase inventory in bulk which took too much of her time and energy. Larisa decided to broaden the assortment of goods she sold by adding clothing items. This helped her reduce transportation time and expenses by not having to make as many trips to buy additional inventory.

Larisa is a serious and prudent business owner. Her perseverance in combination with lending services from “Nadiya Ukraine” has ensured the stable expansion of her business. Even with high competition in this sphere of trade, Larisa’s pleasant manner and willingness to meet customers needs have helped her keep loyal clientele. Larisa has been in this business for 6 years. Currently, she has about $1,200 in inventory. Her net profit amounts to about $300 per month.

Larisa is requesting a loan for $1,200 to use as working capital. She is planning to expand her selection of clothing and shoes by introducing new items which she hopes will attract more customers to her little kiosk. Larisa is planning to invest generated profits into the further expansion of her business and eventually she would like use some to remodel her apartment.

Лариса – одружена, в неї є 14-річний син. Вона починала підприємницьку діяльність з продажу взуття на одному з найбільших ринків м. Запоріжжя. Ларисі часто доводилося їздити на віддалені оптові бази для того, щоб робити закупки, а це, в свою чергу, вимагало багато часу й енергії. Лариса вирішила розширити та урізноманітнити асортимент товарів. Завдяки цьому їй вдалося витрачати менше часу на подорожі, а також зменшити транспортні витрати. Лариса – серйозна та відповідальна. Її наполегливість у поєднанні з кредитними послугами від „Надії України” сприяли поступовому розвитку її бізнесу. Навіть високий рівень конкуренції в торгівлі не став перешкодою для Лариси, її привітне обслуговування та прагнення задовольнити потреби покупців допомогли їй зберегти постійних клієнтів. Лариса займається цим бізнесом вже 6 років. Зараз в неї в товар вкладено приблизно 1200 доларів. Щомісяця вона отримує 300 доларів чистого прибутку. Лариса просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб збільшити власний робочий капітал. Вона планує розширити асортимент найменувань одягу та взуття, закупити нові моделі для того, щоб привабити більше покупців до свого кіоску. Лариса планує вкласти отриманий прибуток в подальший розвиток свого бізнесу і в майбутньому зробити ремонт у власній квартирі.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila was born in Russia and later moved with her family to Ukraine. She entered college in Berdyansk and obtained a degree in elementary education. She also gained a good understanding of people’s psychology which has helped her launch her own business and attract many customers. Currently, Ludmila is a successful entrepreneur selling clothing items in one of the local markets in Berdyansk. She usually purchases inventory in bulk from Russia to resell in Ukraine. She gives preference to Russian wholesalers because their purchasing prices are relatively low, and their inventory is characterized by exceptional quality.

Ludmila learned about “Nadiya Ukraine” from her friends who have been working with our organization for many years. Her business has benefited considerably from micro-lending services since 2003 when she received her first loan.

Ludmila is married with a 20-year-old daughter and a grown son. She has invested her life in her family. Her personal example is the best proof that hard-work and integrity can enable one to be successful in business. Presently, Ludmila has over $4,000 in inventory. She re-stocks her clothing twice a month. Her monthly gross income amounts to $6,000, and her net profit is about $1,200. She has requested a loan of $1,200 to re-supply her inventory and increase her working capital. Ludmila believes that offering a variety of clothing items will help her retain existing customers and find new ones while providing superior service in a competitive marketplace.

Людмила народилася в Росії, пізніше переїхала до України разом з батьками. Потім вступила до коледжу в м. Бердянськ, закінчила навчання, працювала вчителькою молодших класів. Завдяки отриманому досвіду Людмила навчилася чудово розбиратися в психології людей, що також допомогло їй, коли вона починала власну справу, працювала з першими покупцями. Зараз Людмила – успішний підприємець, вона торгує одягом на одному з місцевих ринків м. Бердянськ. Зазвичай вона робить закупки товару в Росії, потім розпродає одяг в Україні. Перевагу надає російським оптовикам, тому що їхні ціни помірно низькі, а товар – відмінної якості. Людмила дізналася про „Надію України” в 2003 році від друзів, які співпрацюють з нашою організацією на протязі певного часу. Завдяки кредитним послугам її бізнес розвивався та досяг успіху. Людмила одружена, в неї є 20-річна дочка та дорослий син. Вона усе своє життя присвятила рідним. Особистий приклад Людмили є найкращим доказом того, що завдяки наполегливій праці та порядності можна досягти успіху в роботі. Зараз в Людмили в товар вкладено трохи більше 4000 доларів. Вона робить закупки двічі в місяць. Щомісячний дохід складає приблизно 6000 доларів, чистий прибуток - приблизно 1200 доларів. Людмила просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб розширити асортимент товарів та збільшити власний робочий капітал. Вона вважає, що широкий вибір одягу допоможе їй зберегти існуючих клієнтів та привабити нових, забезпечивши чудове обслуговування в середовищі з високою конкуренцією.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Igor

texts.en:
Igor runs a small business where he offers tire repair services. He is married and has a son and a daughter. Igor has gained much rich experience in car repair and mechanical work. His gross revenue per month currently amounts to around $800, and his monthly net profit is about $500.

Igor has been working with “Nadiya Ukraine” since 2004. He has gained a reputation as a responsible entrepreneur and a man of integrity. With financial assistance he has been able to purchase a workshop facility for his business. His tire repair business has been very profitable as there is always a need for good car mechanics that are knowledgeable in vehicle repair.

Igor is a Christian and he realizes that God has helped his business to be sustainable and successful. He is requesting a loan for $600 that will enable him to finish some reconstruction on his workshop facility and improve his quality of service. Igor believes that this financial assistance will give him the chance to provide professional service and best meet his customers’ needs. Additional generated profits will help Igor improve his family’s living standards and will allow him to make more investments into the further expansion of his venture.

В Ігоря є невеличка майстерня, він займається шиномонтажем. Він – одружений, в нього є син та дочка. В Ігоря – багатий досвід роботи механіком. Зараз його щомісячний дохід складає приблизно 800 доларів, чистий прибуток - 500 доларів щомісяця. Ігор співпрацює з „Надією України” з 2004 року. Він – відповідальний та порядний. Завдяки фінансовій підтримці він зміг придбати майстерню. Бізнес Ігоря став дуже прибутковим, тому що завжди існує потреба в гарних механіках та спеціалістах з ремонту автомобілів. Ігор – християнин. Він розуміє, що Бог допоміг його бізнесу досягти стабільності та успіху. Він просить про позику в 600 доларів для того, щоб закінчити ремонт у майстерні та покращити якість обслуговування клієнтів. Ігор вважає, що фінансова підтримка допоможе йому забезпечити професійний рівень роботи майстерні та задовольнити потреби клієнтів. Отримані кошти Ігор планує витратити на покращення житлових умов власної родини, а також вкласти частину грошей в подальший розвиток власної справи.

loans.use: To reconstruct his workshop

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Thuy and her husband were born in 1972. They have a son who is 16 years old. The family has just left their parents' home for the first time. Their income is $8 per person per month, which is earned from raising chickens and selling eggs. A recent bird flu problem forced them into a difficult economic situation. They are requesting a loan of $75 so they can restart their egg business.

loans.use: To raise chickens for eggs.

loans.name: Xuyen

texts.en: Xuyen is 32 years old and her husband is 37. They have two daughters, ages 10 and 4. The eldest daughter is a fourth grade student. Xuyen has Hepatitis B and her youngest daughter is often sick due to undernourishment. Xuyen sells fruits and vegetables door-to-door and her husband is a mason.  Their combined income is only $7 per person per month after purchasing medicines for their health issues. Xuyen is requesting a loan of $75 to enable her to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell, which will increase her income and help her provide more nourishment for her children.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en: Thanh is 69. Her husband died a long time ago. She lives with her three sons who are between the ages of 23 and 34. The sons work as laborers, but the work is not stable. Although she is too old to work, she can make baskets out of bamboo to earn extra money for her family. Their income is $7 per person per month. She is requesting a loan of $75 to purchase bamboo to make more baskets and increase her family's income

loans.use: To purchase bamboo for making baskets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Florence wants to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Naomi wants to buy a dairy cow and animal feeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Hannah Njeri Wainaina wants to buy a high-grade dairy cow, fertilizers, and seedlings for her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Manjore Njeri Karau wants to buy a dairy cow and animal feeds.
