loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: I am widow, mother of 3. My husband died of HIV/AIDS. I sell groceries to earn a living. I am the main breadwinner. I will use the loan to expand  my business and meet the basic needs of my dependents and be able to pay for their school fees.

loans.use: I intent to expand and diversify my business

loans.name: Martín

texts.en:
Martín is married and lives in Tampico, Tamaulipas. Six years ago, he retired from his job in the Mexican Navy and started selling jewelry with his wife so they could still afford necessities. The business was successful and thanks to it, after three years Martín was able to buy a taxi and is currently a taxi driver.

After all this time, the taxi needs repairs, new tires and shocks. Martín is asking for a loan of $925 to help cover these expenses so he can continue to offer a quality service to his clients and avoid accidents. He needs your to keep working. You can help improve the life of this family. They are thankful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Martín es casado, vive en Tampico, Tamaulipas. Hace seis años, Martín se retiró de su anterior trabajo en la Armada de México y empezó a vender joyería junto con su esposa, para poder obtener los recursos que necesitaban, les fue muy bien en este negocio y gracias a éste, después de tres años, pudieron adquirir un taxi en el que Martín actualmente trabaja.

Después de todo este tiempo, el taxi necesita reparaciones, llantas nuevas y amortiguadores, para lo que Martín requiere de un crédito por $ 925 dólares que empleará con este fin, para poder ofrecer un servicio de calidad a sus clientes y evitar cualquier tipo de accidente. Él necesita de tu ayuda para seguir trabajando, tú puedes ayudar a mejorar la vida de esta familia, ellos agradecen tu generosidad y apoyo.

loans.use: To make repairs and cover expenses on his taxi.

loans.name: Ariel

texts.en:
Three years ago, after looking for gainful employment in many places without finding anything promising, Ariel decided to start his own business as a shoe salesman to be able to afford the necessities for his family. He is married with two daughters, ages 8 and 13. Love of his family has pushed him to work arduously from day to day and has helped him grow his business, which has borne fruits from the start.

Now, Ariel needs a loan of $475 to buy merchandise to add more supplies, allow him to offer a wider selection to his customers and to continue growing his business. He will repay it within three to six months. You can be a part of helping Ariel's family and business grow. They are thankful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Hace tres años, después de buscar empleo en muchos lugares sin obtener un buen resultado, Ariel decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de calzado, para poder darle lo necesario a su familia, él es casado y tiene dos hijas de 8 y 13 años. El amor por su familia lo ha incentivado a trabajar arduamente día a día y le ha ayudado a crecer con su negocio, que ha rendido frutos desde su inicio.

Ahora Ariel necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para surtir mejor su negocio y poder ofrecerle una mayor variedad a sus clientes, para continuar creciendo con su negocio, él ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio y en la vida de la familia de Ariel, ellos agradecen sinceramente su apoyo.

loans.use: Buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a hard-working and responsible married father of six. He works for a business, however he felt the need to earn extra income to cover all the family expenses and pay for his children's education. So two years ago he started selling milk products and chorizo to his co-workers, neighbors and family, and the demand for his products increased and he gained many more customers.

To cover all of his customers' orders, Daniel is asking for a loan of $250 to buy the food supplies he needs to continue growing his business. He will repay it within three to six months. Daniel is making the effort to move his business and his family forward, but he needs your help to do it.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Daniel es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable, es casado y tiene seis hijos. Él trabaja en una empresa, sin embargo, sentía la necesidad de obtener un ingreso extra para poder solventar los compromisos del hogar y de la escuela de sus hijos, y fue así como hace dos años inició con la venta de lácteos y chorizo entre sus compañeros de trabajo, vecinos y familiares, la demanda por sus productos se ha incrementado y ha ganado muchos clientes más.

Para poder cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes, Daniel necesita de un crédito por $250 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía, para continuar creciendo con su negocio, él ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses. Daniel esta dispuesto a esforzarse por sacar adelante su negocio y su familia, pero necesita de tu ayuda para poder hacerlo, en tus manos esta el bienestar de esta familia, no lo dudes más.

loans.use: Buy milk products, chorizo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jesús Francisco

texts.en:
Jesús has dedicated himself to working in urban transportation since he was 18. He started as a driver working under others, and thanks to the savings he accumulated and the support of his family he was able to purchase a bus and later renovate and overhaul it. Now Jesús drives his own route and can offer his family a better quality of life and give his three daughters a good education.

Jesús is hard-working and responsible. He is only looking out for his family's best and wants to grow his small business. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to use for maintenance on the bus in order to continue to give his customers a high-quality service and eliminate the probability of an accident. Contribute to the growth of this business. Jesús and his family are grateful for your generosity and support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Desde que el señor Jesús tenía 18 años se dedica a conducir transportes urbanos, trabajaba para otras personas, y gracias a los ahorros que pudo acumular y al apoyo de su familia se hizo posible la adquisición de un autobús, y posteriormente la renovación del modelo, ahora Jesús conduce su propio camión y puede ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una buena educación a sus tres hijas.

Trabajo, esfuerzo y responsabilidad son características que posee Jesús, él sólo busca lo mejor a su familia, y quiere crecer como microempresario, ahora necesita de un préstamo por $ 1200 dólares que empleará en el mantenimiento de su autobús, para evitar cualquier tipo de accidente y ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio, Jesús y su familia agradecen tu generosidad y apoyo.

loans.use: Bus maintenance.

loans.name: Jesús

texts.en:
Jesús is a hard-working and responsible married father of four. His brother-in-law is a carpenter who works on doors and windows, and when he needed an extra hand, Jesús helped him for a time. That's how Jesús got involved with this type of work. Two years ago, Jesús decided to become independent and form his own business. Fortunately his customers have increased and he has never been lacking work. From this, he has been able to move his household forward and help his children's education.

Jesús wants his business to keep growing and is willing to work hard to make that possible. All he needs is a $250 loan to buy a metal cutter, which will increase his production and offer a better service to his customers. He plans on repaying the loan within three to six months. You can play a fundamental role in the growth of this business and the quality of this family.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Jesús G. es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable, él es casado y tiene cuatro hijos, su cuñado se dedica a la elaboración de puertas y ventanas y como tenía trabajo acumulado Jesús le ayudo un tiempo y de esta manera fue involucrándose en el negocio. Hace dos años, Jesús decidió independizarse e iniciar su propia empresa, afortunadamente sus clientes se han incrementado y nunca le ha faltado trabajo, con esta labor Jesús ha podido sacar adelante su hogar y de la educación de sus hijos.

Jesús quiere que su negocio pueda crecer, y esta dispuesto a trabajar muy duro para hacerlo posible, sólo necesita de un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que utilizará para la compra de una cortadora metálica, con la que podrá incrementar su producción y otorgar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Tú puedes ser parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio y en la vida de esta familia, no lo pienses más, tú puedes ayudarlos.

loans.use: Buy a metal cutter

loans.name: Jesús Vicente

texts.en:
Jesús is retired, and the money he gets from his pension isn't enough to cover his family's expenses. He is married and has a son. As a way to stay active and be able to provide his family necessities, he started his own blacksmith business five years ago. He has always been dedicated to this line of work and has a lot of experience, so he offers a superior service and the demand for his work has increased a lot.

Currently, Jesús has a lot of orders from customers and needs to take out a loan of $250 to buy materials needed to fulfill them. He plans to repay the loan within three to six months. You can help Jesús continue working. He needs your support and is sincerely grateful for your generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Don Jesús es jubilado, y con el ingreso de su pensión no era posible cubrir los gastos de su familia, él es casado y tiene un hijo, como una manera de no estar inactivo y completar los recursos que necesitaba para su hogar, hace cinco años inició su propio negocio de herrería, él siempre ha dedicado a esta labor y tiene mucha experiencia, por lo que sus trabajos son muy buenos y la demanda por ellos se ha incrementado mucho.

Actualmente, Jesús tiene muchos pedidos de sus clientes pero para poder sacar su trabajo necesita de un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que utilizará en la compra de material que requiere para la elaboración de sus productos, él ofrece devolver este cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Ayuda a Jesús a que continúe trabajando, él necesita de tu apoyo y agradece sinceramente tu generosidad.

loans.use: Buy hardward supplies

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.en:
José Antonio is a married father of five and is very active and enterprising. Three years ago, after realizing that his salary could not cover his family's expenses and the education of his children, he decided to start his own business, selling jerseys and T-shirts. Thanks to the help of his friends he was able to get his start, and little by little with a lot of effort and hard work he was able to acquire more customers and sell his products to sports teams, schools and offices.

Currently, José needs a loan of $250 to buy merchandise with the hope of offering his customers a wider variety and covering his growing demand. He plans to repay the loan within three to six months. José is counting on your support to help grow his business and keep his family moving forward. He is sincerely grateful for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El señor José Antonio es casado y tiene cinco hijos, él es un hombre muy activo y emprendedor, al darse cuenta que con su salario no podía solventar todo los gastos de su hogar y de la escuela de sus hijos, decidió iniciar su propio negocio hace tres años, vendiendo camisetas deportivas y de vestir, gracias a la ayuda de uno de sus amigos pudo iniciar y poco a poco con esfuerzo y mucho trabajo ha logrado incrementar sus clientes y surte a equipos deportivos, escuelas e instituciones.

En estos momentos, José necesita de un préstamo por $250 dólares para la comprar de mercancía, con la que espera poder ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes y de esta cubrir su demanda, él ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses. José cuenta con tu apoyo para hacer crecer su negocio y sacar adelante a su familia, y agradece sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: Buy jerseys and T-shirts to sell.

loans.name: Juanita Sonia

texts.en:
Juanita is an enterprising married mother of two with high hopes of moving up in the world. Her husband is a soldier and a little while ago they received credit to purchase a home. The family's debt increased with the mortgage and the costs of her children's education, and they needed to earn extra income to cover the costs. Four years ago, Juanita decided to start her own business selling chemical cleaning products, milk products and mango desserts. The love of her family and faith in her husband has been a big motivator.

Currently, Juanita's business has grown a lot, and she needs a $50 loan to help her buy merchandise to meet the demands of her customers and continue to grow her business. She plans to repay the loan within three to six months. With your help Juanita can do great things. She and her family are grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Juanita es una mujer emprendedora y con grandes deseos de superación, ella es casada y tiene una hija de 15 años y un hijo de 7. Su esposo es soldador y hace poco obtuvo un crédito que le permitió adquirir una casa, el pago de la hipoteca y los gastos de la escuela de sus hijos, incrementaron los deudas familiares y para obtener un ingreso extra, hace cuatro años, Juanita decidió iniciar su propio negocio, vendiendo productos químicos, lácteos y postres de mango. El amor a su familia y el fiel compromiso con su esposo la han motivado todo este tiempo.

Actualmente, el negocio de Juanita ha crecido mucho, por lo que necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 50 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y continuar creciendo con su negocio, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Con tu ayuda Juanita puede hacer grandes cosas, no lo dudes más y contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio y al bienestar de esta familia, ellos agradecen tu apoyo.

loans.use: Buy cleaning products, milk products and desserts to sell.

loans.name: Julián

texts.en:
Julián is a young entrepreneur. Three years ago, he decided to start his own business selling fish, seafood, steaks, etc. with the help of his family. He started out of necessity to give him the funds to continue his education and to help his family with expenses. The business he started with few resources has grown and now Julián also works with his brothers and sisters.

The desire to move up in the world has motivated Julián to continue growing his business. Currently, he needs a $100 loan to buy supplies and ingredients so he can continue to offer a good product to his customers. He plans to repay it within three to six months. Your support can help improve the quality of life of Julián and his family and help him reach his dreams of finishing his studies and being a successful businessman. He is grateful for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Julián es un joven emprendedor, desde hace tres años decidió iniciar su propio negocio donde vende pescado, robalo, besugo, filetes, bagre y cebiche, con ayuda de familiares que se dedican a lo mismo. Empezó por la necesidad de obtener recursos que le permitieran continuar estudiando y para apoyar a su familia con los gastos del hogar, el negocio que inició con pocos recursos ahora ha estado creciendo y ahora Julián cuenta también con el apoyo de sus hermanos.

Los deseos de superación han motivado a Julián a continuar creciendo con su negocio, en estos momentos él necesita de un crédito por $100 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía que le permita tener surtido su negocio para poder ofrecer buenos productos a sus clientes, él ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses. Con tu ayuda puedes mejorar la vida de esta familia y contribuir a la realización del sueño de Julián, de concluir sus estudios y ser un empresario exitoso, él agradece sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: Buy fish, seafood, steaks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Brijida Maribel

texts.en:
Since she was very little, Brijida has distinguished herself as a very hard-working woman. Ever since she was a child she sold whatever items she could to help her family. She always wanted to study, but she had to work in order to afford her education. This is how she started her grocery business. Now she also provides for her family - her young son and her husband, Florencio, who works as many other men in that region do as a lumberjack. Unfortunately, that line of work is seasonal, so they often depend on her to provide for all of their necessities. They live in the city of Guachochi in the Tarahumara mountains, one of the poorest parts of Mexico.

Currently Brijida is asking for a loan of $1,200 to construct a new locale for her small shop, with the goal of providing a better service to her customers. The continued growth of her business requires your support. She plans on repaying the loan within six to 12 months.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Desde muy pequeña Brijida se ha distinguido por ser una mujer muy trabajadora, pues desde niña vendía cualquier cosa con tal de ayudar en su casa a su familia y como siempre quiso estudiar, tenía que trabajar para costearse sus estudios en la academia y posteriormente en la escuela para maestros. Es así como inició su negocio de venta de abarrotes para ayudar a la economía de su familia, la cual esta compuesta por su pequeño hijo y su esposo Florencio, el cual trabaja como muchos otros hombres de aquella región, en la explotación de madera, cortando pinos y llevándolos a los aserraderos para procesarlos e industrializarlos. Desafortunadamente la actividad de su esposo es muy variable, ya que depende mucho del clima y en época de frío se ve afectada porque no se puede trabajar. Ella vive en la ciudad de Guachochi en la Sierra Tarahumara, una de las zonas de ingresos mas bajos en México.

Actualmente Brijida esta solicitando un crédito por $ 1,200 USD ya que esta construyendo un nuevo local para su pequeña tienda, con el fin de proporcionar un mejor servicio a sus clientes los cuales la han estado prefiriendo, es por eso que requiere de tu apoyo para continuar con el crecimiento de su negocio. El préstamo lo piensa pagar en un plazo de 6-12 meses.

loans.use: To build a new locale for her grocery store.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is a married father of three originally from the town of Rocheachi in the Tarahumara Mountains. According to tradition, natives of the region consume Pinole, a product made from corn, as part of their daily diet. For the last six years Antonio has been making and selling this traditional dish with his family. When they started the business, the baking was all done by hand, but the y now have a tiny grind and a corn toaster, which has helped them increase production and allow them to teach others in the community this time-honored tradition.

Antonio is asking for a loan of $375 to help him buy raw materials to increase his business. He plans to repay within four to eight months. You can help add to the well-being of his family and also support the local economy of his impoverished region.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Don Antonio es originario de una comunidad en la Sierra Tarahumara llamada Rocheachi, cerca de Guachochi, en Chihuahua, al norte de México. Él esta casado y tiene tres hijos, los cuales le ayudan en su negocio. Cuenta que la tradición entre la comunidad de los Rarámuris (nativos de aquélla región) es consumir el Pinole de maíz como parte de su dieta alimenticia diaria, es por eso que desde hace más de seis años el y su familia se dedican a la elaboración y venta de este producto original, el cual elaboran de acuerdo a la forma tradicional de tostar el maíz; sus hijos y su esposa, le ayudan pesando, moliendo y etiquetando el producto. . Cuando iniciaron su negocio, llevaban todo el proceso de elaboración en forma manual, hoy en día ya cuentan con un pequeño molino y una tostadora de maíz, lo cual le ha ayudado a incrementar su producción y poder abastecer con su producto a los albergues escolares de educación indígena que hay por esa comunidad.

Antonio esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de $375 USD para apoyo en su capital de trabajo, el cual piensa pagar en un plazo de 4-8 meses. Tú puedes contribuir al bienestar de Antonio y su familia, apoyándolo con el préstamo y de esta manera estarás apoyando la economía de la comunidad que vive en la Sierra Tarahumara de México.

loans.use: Buy raw materials like corn

loans.name: No

texts.en: No is 38 years old and her husband, Nam, is 44. Their daughter is 17. She has stopped going to school in order to work. They have 1000 square meters of land for cultivation. No also sells cylindrical sticky rice cakes door-to-door. Their income is $10 per person per month. No is requesting a loan of $75 to purchase the materials for making more rice cakes. This will increase her sales and her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase the materials for making sticky rice cakes

loans.name: Cecil

texts.en: Student hostel construction is a very lucrative venture in the Garden City of Kumasi. This is a result of a lot of educational institutions being established in the country. Cecil W. has been in the hostel construction business for 2 years. The demand for his services outstrip what he is able to provide for the numerous students. He requires a loan of $1200 from KIVA Microfunds to enable him to roof one of the student hostels to enable him to meet the demands from the students. He is a trusted customer of Kraban Support Foundation and has participated in the TEACH lending skills program.

loans.use: Purchase Roofing Sheets

loans.name: Ni

texts.en: Ni is 53 years old, and is single. She provides for her 86-year-old mother and her mentally ill sister. They have no land aside from the 30 square meters for their home. Ni’s family earns only $5 per person per month from Ni's small grocery store. Ni requests a loan of $75 to increase the items she can sell in her store and grow her business.

loans.use: To supply her grocery store.

loans.name: Mohammad Smail

texts.en: Mohammad Smail is 35 years old. He lives in a household of four in District 6 of Kabul,  Afghanistan. He is married. He is a car mechanic but he is working in another shop. He has six years of experience and now he want to borrow a loan to take a shop and buy all the materials for a shop to work on it. He is the supporter of his family. He wants to help his family and join his children in school to study. He wants to work hard and be a good business dealer and good mechanic of cars. Now he is very happy with this loan of AFSG.

loans.use: To buy extra materials for the shop.

loans.name: Sayaad Ahamad

texts.en: Sayaad Ahamad is 40 years old. He lives in a household of eight in District 6 of Kabul,  Afghanistan. He is married and lives with his family of five children. He has a retail-food business. Working on it now, he wants to take a loan to buy extra things like rice, milk, baskets and other materials to make a big business and to find extra clients. Also, he has six years of experience with the shop. He is sure that he can work with this loan and he is very happy now.

loans.use: To buy more rice, milk and extra material.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Dong

texts.en: Dong is 26 years old and her husband is 28. Their son is 6. Because they have no land, Dong sells groceries from her home. Her husband works as a motorbike taxi driver. Their income is about $10 per person per month. She is requesting t a loan of $75 so she can increase the items she sells in her store which will attract more customers and raise her family's income.

loans.use: To supply the grocery store.

loans.name: Allah Gul

texts.en: Allah Gul is 35 years old. He lives in a household of five in District 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with three children. He has a retail-food business. He wants to improve his economic situation. He wants to take a loan to buy extra things for the shop to increase his number of customers as well as make good relationships with people. He is trying a lot to make good business.

loans.use: To buy extra materials for shop.

loans.name: Whaida

texts.en: Whaida is 34 years old and lives in a household of five in District 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married and is a tailor. To better support her family, she wants to take a loan to buy new machines and all the materials for machines to make a good business. She is a good tailor because she has 10 years of experience working as a tailor. She wants to make a good life for her children. She wants to place them in good schools and give her husband work .

loans.use: To buy extra machines for tailor business.

loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business of selling household goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business.

loans.name: Quy

texts.en: Miss Quy and her husband have three children between 7 and 12 years old. The eldest son suffers from a disability, and Miss Quy must also support parents who are 87 and 77 and they are often sick. Miss Quy sells fish at the local market and her husband is a hired laborer, as they don’t have any land for cultivation. Income for her family from her fish sales is not enough so she had to borrow a loan with 36% interest from money lenders. Now Miss Quy wants to borrow $50 through the Kiva program to help her fish business, and she says she will repay her loan monthly.

loans.use: To sell fish at the local market

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Mrs. Van and her husband have two children between 25 and 16 years of age. Tuyen, her first child, is going to university and her youngest is in grade 12. In addition, Mrs Van must support the child of one son because his father is still a student. They have a little land of about 3,000 square meters which is planted with rice. Mr. Hai, her husband, works as a daily laborer but he can’t find work easily so selling cakes is important for them to increase their income by $1.5/person/month. Mrs. Van would like to borrow $75 for her cake business and also wants to develop a pig raising business.

loans.use: Girdle cake business

loans.name: My

texts.en: My was born in 1968, and her husband, Trung, was born in 1967. They have three children, ages ten, seven, and four and all of them are going to school. Miss My doesn’t have any land for cultivation so she sells bread at the local market. Her husband works as a day laborer but the work is not stabL.. Tri, her first child, became blind due to an accident whiL. he played with his friends in school. The family spent a lot of money to pay for his medical treatmen. Miss My previously borrowed $50 and subsequently increased her income by $1.5 /person/month and her average income is now $12/person/month. She has already repaid this loan. Now she wants to borrow $75 to help improve her bread business.

loans.use: Sell bread at the local market

loans.name: Dum

texts.en: Mrs. Dum is 57 years old and must support her grandchild, Trang, who is in grade five. Mrs. Dum is very poor and she does not even have a hut to live in, but the neighbors built her a house. Mrs. Dum sells fish in a small market to earn money for her and Trang. She wants a loan of $50 to increase her fish business and says she will repay the loan weekly.

loans.use: sells fish

loans.name: Sang

texts.en: S. is 44 and her husband is 40. They have four children between ages 10 and 19 - two sons and two daughters. Tam, her oldest daughter, stopped going to school and works as a daily laborer at HCM city. Mrs. S. supports the other three young children who go to school. The family has about two hectares of land to plant cashew nut trees on and intercrop with cassava, but the land is very poor and they have no capital to buy fertilizer, so the family doesn’t harvest much. Mrs. S. suffers from asthma, so she tries to sell bread at a small market. A retail business is important to increase her family income by $1/person/month where the average income is low at $8.5/person/month. S. wants to borrow $75 to improve her bread selling business and to buy fertilizer for her cashew nut trees.

loans.use: Sell breads at a small market and buy fertilizer for cashew nut trees

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Miss Sen is 34 and her husband is 37 years old. They have five children and all of them are going to school. They don’t have any land for cultivation. Mr. Tuan, her husband, suffers from cardiac problems so he can’t do hard work. He has a small bike repair shop at a village market and Miss Sen sells fish at the market and raises one female pig at a hut. Miss Sen increased her income by $2/person/month because of her previous loan and also repaid it on time. This time, she wants to borrow $100 so that she can expand the shop and her fish business.

loans.use: Expanding her fish selling business

loans.name: Dung

texts.en: Miss Dung and her husband Mr. Lam have two children ages seven and thirteen. They must support their two children going to school and also must support Mr. Lam's mother, Mrs. Gai, who is 72 years old. Mr. Lam has a congenital disease, is paralytic and must travel by wheelchair. He can, however, sell lottery tickets from door to door to earn money for their family. Miss Dung sells confectionery from home. They do not have any land for cultivation so the selling business of both Miss Dung and her husband are important to earn money for their family and has increased their income by $1/person/month. The average income is low at $8/person/month. Miss Dung has already repaid her first loan and would like to borrow $50 more to increase her confectionary selling business.

loans.use: Selling confectionary from home

loans.name: Dung

texts.en: Miss Dung and her husband have 2 children between 13 and 7. They must support two children going to school and they also must support her husband’s mother, Mrs Gai, she is 72 years old. Mr Lam, her husband was congenital disease. Mr Lam was paralytic and he must move by wheelchair. However, he can sell lottery tickets from door to door to earn money for their family. Miss Dung sells confectionery at home. They do not have any land for cultivation so selling business of both of Miss Dung and her husband are important to earn money for family. Their income increased by $1/person/month and average income is low at 8/person/month. She has already repaid the first loan.   She asks to borrow $50 for their selling business.

loans.use: sells confectionery at home

loans.name: Gia

texts.en: Mrs Gai’s husband died long ago and she is supporting her son by herself. Thien, her son, is in grade nine. Mrs Gai has a littL. land which contain cashew nut trees. Now, the cashew nut trees don’t produce nuts any longer. Mrs Gai also has problems with her sciatic nerve so she can’t do any hard work as a farmer; she only can buy rice from door to door and then sell it to an agent locally. Mrs Gai borrowed a loan of $50 with no interest from Mekong Plus organization which has helped increase her income by about $5/person/month (The average income is $16/person/month). She has already repaid this loan on time and now she would like to borrow $75 to increase her rice selling business.

loans.use: To buy & sell rice

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Mrs. Kim is 57 years old. Her husband left her for another woman. Mrs. Kim must support her son’s family also, because Manh, her son, is mentally retarded. Manh works as a daily laborer but he can’t find work easily. Mahn's son, unfortunately, was born with a harelip and the family spent a large amount of money on his operations. Mrs. Kim has littL. land for rice cultivation, so selling confectionary is important to increase their income. Her average income is low, at $8/person/month. She wants to borrow $50 for her confectionary business and will work hard to repay her loan every month.

loans.use: Confectionary business

loans.name: Sitora

texts.en:
Sitora’a husband is an invalid; he does not work anywhere. With a baby on her hands, she tried to earn money. Sitora trades the detergent and other cleaning products in the central market of Isfara. She has been involved in this kind of trade for 2 years. Before this, she sew bed-clothes (pillowcases, blanket covers, bed sheets) and sold them in various markets around Isfara district. Then she turned to the trade of detergent.

She began with $100 and constantly expanded her assortment with other goods: toilet papers, candles, shampoos, and other things. Her last loan was in the amount of $450. A year ago she lost a large amount of money, which she had saved for a trip to buy goods. It was a big loss for her. She continued receiving loans and constantly restored her small business. She earned money for her family and at the same time paid off her loan.

At present she needs a regular trading place. Sitora wants to receive loan of $700 for expansion of her business and also to rent a place for keeping her goods and to improve her working conditions.

loans.use: Rent a larger space

loans.name: Enakhon

texts.en:
Enakhon was born in 1941. She started receiving loans in February, 2006. In spite of her age, she works to raise her granddaughter, whom she supports. Sometimes her granddaughter assistes her in the trade.

K. Enakhon trades children clothes and shoes in the open-air market. Because she does not have a regular trading place, she has to go to the district market and trade there. Her day starts with preparing food for her grandchild and then going to the market to trade, which is located 15 km from her home. Her assortment of goods is not large, but it is enough to make a living.

At present she needs $500 to equip her trading place with a light tent, thus improving her trading conditions. This will make it possible to earn additional profit and improve the food for her family.

K.’s granddaughter is in the photo.

loans.use: Improve trading conditions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a new bicycle for his bicycle taxi business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new bicycle for his bicycle taxi business

loans.name: Shah Gul

texts.en:
Shah Gul is 44 years old. She lives in a household of six in District 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. Her son has a retail-food shop for which Shah Gul took a loan. The shop is doing a good business. Now she wants to take anther loan to buy extra materials, like rice, milk, potatoes, onions, etc., to do better business. She wants to develop close relationships with people and make good clients to be a great shopkeeper. She also wants to find a good income each month. Now she is very happy and her son is also very happy with this loan.

Note: the picture featured in this business profile is the husband or relative of the female entrepreneur in Afghanistan it is culturally unacceptable to post a picture of a woman to the internet but the loan is to the female entrepreneur.

loans.use: To buy more extra materials for shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new bicycle for his bicycle taxi business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new bicycle for his bicycle taxi business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a bicycle for his bicycle taxi business

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is married with a 3-year-old son. For awhile he worked for a transportation company. However, the organization went bankrupt and Sergei was forced to find other ways to support his family. That is how he ended up as a taxi driver. Today he owns a car and provides transportation services throughout Ukraine. The business is the only source of income for his family. Sergei works very hard, sometimes without days off or vacation, in order to bring in enough income. He uses a walkie-talkie to help him facilitate his work and get right to a pick-up a lot faster. Sergei has been in this business for 10 years. His determination and strong will to succeed have helped him keep his business stable and sustainable and have promoted its expansion. Sergei has received and paid back 23 different loans from “Nadiya Ukraine”. Currently, his daily income is about $30-40. Sergei would like to get a loan for $1,000 to fix the engine and do some welding work on his car. One of his long-term plans is to eventually purchase a new vehicle. We are confident that the modesty, diligence and responsibility that have helped Sergei develop his venture and gain a good reputation among other taxi drivers will help him promptly repay this loan and allow him to succeed in his business endeavors.

Сергій – одружений, в нього є 3-річний син. Певний час він працював в автопарку. Потім організація збанкротувала, Сергій був змушений шукати інших можливостей забезпечувати родину. Так він став водієм таксі. Зараз у Сергія є власне авто, він пропонує послуги пасажирських перевезень на території України. Бізнес – це єдине джерело прибутку для його родини. Сергій наполегливо працює, іноді зовсім без вихідних та відпустки для того, щоб дати рідним усе необхідне. Він користується рацією, що значно полегшує його роботу та допомагає швидше добратися до місця виклику. Сергій займається цим бізнесом вже на протязі 10 років. Його наполегливість та сила волі допомогли йому побудувати стабільний бізнес та сприяли його росту. Сергій отримав та сплатив 23 позик від „Надії України”. Зараз його щоденний прибуток складає приблизно 30-40 доларів. Сергій хотів би отримати позику в 1000 доларів на ремонт двигуна та кузову. В майбутньому він планує придбати новіше авто. Ми переконані, що скромність, ретельна праця та відповідальність, які допомогли Сергію почати власну справу та заробити таку гарну репутацію серед інших водіїв, допоможуть йому сплатити цю позику та досягти більшого успіху в бізнесі.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new bicycle for his bicycle taxi business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new bicycle for his bicycle taxi business

loans.name: Roya

texts.en:
Roya is 28 years old. She lives in a household of three in District 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She wants to help her husband because her husband has a cycle shop. He needs bicycle parts and she wants to take a loan from AFSG to buy extra materials for the shop and make a good business. She wants to start a good life with their children attending school.


Note: the picture featured in this business profile is the husband or relative of the female entrepreneur in Afghanistan it is culturally unacceptable to post a picture of a woman to the internet but the loan is to the female entrepreneur

loans.use: Buying parts of bicycles.

loans.name: Yaqoot

texts.en: Yaqoot is 43 years old. She lives in a household of five in District 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is a quilt-maker and also a gardener. She wants to take another loan to spend it making quilts for sale and also to improve her garden. She wants better crops than in the past, with more vegetables in the garden and different kinds of apples to sell in the bazaar. Now she can further her life and she is very happy.

loans.use: Buying Materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her household products shop business

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia was born in 1990 and lives with household of  seven in District 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married and has four children. Her husband sells fresh fruits in the bazaar near the road. She wants to borrow a loan for her husband to take a shop for them and buy more fresh fruits and to find more clients. They want to make his shop bigger and work on it. 



Note: the picture featured in this business profile is the husband or relative of the female entrepreneur in Afghanistan it is culturally unacceptable to post a picture of a woman to the internet but the loan is to the female entrepreneur.

loans.use: Buying fresh fuits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stock and move his grocery business to a permanent shop

loans.name: Hakima

texts.en:
Hakima is 29 years old and lives in a household of eight in District 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is a widow who lost her husband during the war in Kabul. She took a loan for her son's shop to buy goods because he is the only one to support his family. He has had his shop since he is 16 years old. He is also a student at school. He works part time in the shop and now he can study. He also can work with his mother in the shop. His mother proud of her son.


Note: the picture featured in this business profile is the husband or relative of the female entrepreneur in Afghanistan it is culturally unacceptable to post a picture of a woman to the internet but the loan is to the female entrepreneur.

loans.use: Buying goods for shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of video cassettes, radio cassettes, vcds ans dvds for his business

loans.name: Sakena

texts.en:
Sakena is 62 years old and lives in a household of four in District 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is an old woman who took a loan for her son who had a shop of fuel and gas. She therefore took the loan to buy gas, fuel and balloons of gas to support his family financially because he is the worker of the house. He is glad to increase his business.


Note: the picture featured in this business profile is the husband or relative of the female entrepreneur in Afghanistan it is culturally unacceptable to post a picture of a woman to the internet but the loan is to the female entrepreneur.

loans.use: Buying Fuel & Gas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To rent a permanent store and buy more stocks for her herbal medicine business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock and rent a location for his retail shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of used handbags that will enable him diversify his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of her used handbag selling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock and a refrigerator for her fish business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock for her fish business

loans.name: Roger M.

texts.en:
Roger A. lives on Obispo del Llano Street in Alto Chuijini on the west side of La Paz. He is 34 years old and is self-employed in setting up computers and installing software on them for sale to customers in their homes. He now lives in a room in his parents' house and he is asking for this loan to build two more rooms to live in, improving his family's quality of life. His job and our study show he will be able to repay this loan with no problems.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

Roger A. vive en la calle Obispo del Llano de la zona Alto Chuijini ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene 34 años y trabaja independientemente, armando computadoras e instalando programas en las mismas, que luego vende a clientes a domicilio. Actualmente vive en una habitación en la casa de sus padres y el crédito que solicita está destinado a la construcción de dos habitaciones en obra fina, las que ocupará a su culminación y le permitirá mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. Su trabajo y el estudio económico realizado al señor Roger A., demuestran que puede cubrir el préstamo sin problema alguno.

loans.use: To build two rooms.

loans.name: Marco A.

texts.en:
Marco is 31 years old and single and he lives in Alto Chuijini on the west side of La Paz. He buys sporting goods such as backpacks wholesale and resells them to retailers around the city. Right now he lives in a single room in his parents' home, but with money he saved he built two more sturdy rooms. This loan will go towards finishing these rooms so Marco can move in and improve his quality of life. Our studies show that with the job he has Marco will be able to repay the loan without problems.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

Marco tiene 31 años y vive solo en la zona Alto Chuijini ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz; se dedica a la compra al por mayor de artículos deportivos (mochilas, buzos, etc.) que luego venden a distintos puestos de venta al detalle en la ciudad. Actualmente vive en una habitación proporcionada por sus padres, pero con dinero ahorrado producto de su trabajo, construyó dos habitaciones en obra gruesa. El crédito irá destinado a la conclusión de las dos habitaciones en obra fina, las que ocupara a su culminación, mejorando notablemente sus condiciones de vida. Su trabajo y el estudio económico realizado demuestran que puede cubrir el préstamo sin dificultad.

loans.use: Construction

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Mrs. Theresa O. is a 40-year-old woman. She is married with four children. She started the above business in 2004 in the semi-urban area of Benin City, the state capital of Edo State, Nigeria. According to her, she came to LAPO (2006) when her business was at a standstill. With the loan of $350, she will expand her firewoods business to serve a wide range of people in her local communities.

loans.use: To buy more wood for sale

loans.name: Am

texts.en: "I am happy to be an LAPO member," says Mrs. Am E.. She is 40 years old and happily married. She has been an LAPO client for over 5 years. She lives in Benin City. She wishes to use the loan for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Catalina V.

texts.en:
Catalina and her husband are shoemakers who sell their goods at craft markets in La Paz and El Alto. Their workshop is located in the Tembladerani neighborhood in La Paz. They have six children and live in the May 1st nighborhood of El Alto. This loan will help them buy raw materials such as leather so they can increase production to keep up with demand. This is their first loan, but our evaluation qualifies them for credit, which will help them increase their income and repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

Catalina y su esposo son artesanos en cuero, fabrican calzados, los mismos que comercializa en ferias populares de la ciudad de La Paz y EL Alto. El taller de trabajo se halla ubicado en la Zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz. Tienen 6 hijos y viven en la zona 1ro de Mayo de la Ciudad de El Alto. El destino del crédito es comprar materia prima (cuero) para incrementar su producción y satisfacer la cantidad de demanda que existe en su mercado. Es su primer crédito, la evaluación certifica y califica para poder otorgarles el crédito, que servirá para que incrementen sus ingresos y cumplir con sus obligaciones.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ciriaca

texts.en:
Ciriaca works with her second son. She has a car which she uses to collect milk from the rural Altiplano de La Paz area and transport it to a commercial dairy called PIL Andina. This is the source of income for herself and her three children, who live in the Villa Bolivar neighborhood of Al Alto. The loan will increase her working capital so that she can purchase the amount of milk demanded by the dairy. She has a good credit history with IMPRO which lets her seek this loan to help raise her income and the standard of living of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

Ciriaca trabaja con su 2do hijo; tiene un carro con el que recolecta leche de vaca de las áreas rurales del Altiplano de La Paz (zona rural conocida por ese nombre), para comercializarlo a la empresa industrializadota de leche PIL Andina S.A. Esta se constituye en su fuente de ingreso para la manutención a sus tres hijos, vive en la zona Villa Bolívar de la Ciudad de El Alto. El destino del crédito es para incrementar capital de trabajo, de esa forma comprar la cantidad de leche demandada por la empresa PIL Andina. Su historial crediticio con Impro es bueno, lo que le permite acceder a otro crédito para incrementar sus ingresos económicos u mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa F. is 41 years old. She owns her own home in Alpacoma on the outskirts of La Paz where she lives with her husband Jose Vargas and their six children, four of them minors. She sells groceries from a kiosk in El Alto. She would like to build a wall around her three-room home. This loan will pay to remove soil from the yard and build a wall around it. This is her second construction loan from IMPRO. Their first-class record with IMPRO shows them to be good borrowers, capable of making monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

Teresa Fernández tiene 41 años, vive en una vivienda de su propiedad en la zona Alpacoma a las afueras de la ciudad de La Paz, junto a su esposo, el señor José Vargas y sus seis hijos, de los cuales cuatro aun son menores de edad, realiza compra y venta de abarrotes en un quiosco ( puesto de venta en la calle) en la ciudad de El Alto. La vivienda de la señora Teresa Fernández cuenta con tres habitaciones, pero no tiene amurallado. El crédito solicitado será para la construcción de un muro de contención y remoción de tierra del patio en una primera fase. Esta es la segunda vez que recurre a Impro para obtener un crédito para construcción (la anterior fue para terminar de construir una habitación). Su historial en nuestra institución los clasifica como clientes 1 al ser puntuales en el pago de sus cuotas mensuales lo que le permiten acceder a este crédito, demostrando que pueden cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Construction.

payments.comment: Early payoff. Teresa will apply for a new loan.

loans.name: Griselda R.

texts.en:
Griselda lives with her husband Francisco Cacasaca in the Llojeta neighborhood of La Paz. They are both 38 years old and have two children ages 11 and 13. They buy construction materials such as bricks and cement wholesale and resell them out of their home making deliveries to areas the that the distributors won't. They have layed concrete for an addition to their two-room home hoping to make it a better place to live and to conduct business. Their employment and credit history with us give them access them this credit, as they have shown they can repay it.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

Griselda, vive junto a su esposo, el señor Francisco Cacasaca en su domicilio ubicado el la zona de Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz., tienen38 años y dos hijos de 13 y 11 años y se dedica a la compra y venta de material de construcción al detalle ( ladrillo y cemento) que compra de las distribuidoras al por mayor; su negocio se halla en su mismo domicilio efectuando entregas en las obras donde consigue vender sus productos, normalmente en laderas donde las distribuidoras no efectúan entregas en obra. Su vivienda cuenta con dos habitaciones y tiene construidos los cimientos para una habitación, el crédito solicitado es para ampliación iniciando la construcción de esa habitación adicional en la fase de obra gruesa, con el objetivo de otorgar mayor comodidad a su familia y negocio. Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios en nuestra institución les permiten acceder a este crédito, demostrando que pueden cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Construction.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra sells roasted chicken. She is 21 years old and has two children. Her husband helps her tend the business. Their home and business are both in Alto Chijini in La Paz. They prepare the take-out food daily. This is the first loan she has taken out and it will go to paying for bulk groceries, sauces and vegetables, saving money. She previously tended a similar stand as an employee before setting up shop on her own. She has access to this credit on the strength of her work experience and her receipts, which show she will be able to repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

Alejandra vende pollo al broaster. Tiene 21 años y dos hijos, su esposo le ayuda en la atención de su negocio. Su negocio y domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Alto Chijini de la ciudad de La Paz. Sus ventas son diarias por se trata de comida al paso y la preparación la realiza diariamente. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra abarrotes, salsas, y verdura en cantidad para reducir sus costos. Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia porque atendía un negocio similar anteriormente como empleada y hace un año que instaló su propio negocio. Sus ingresos demuestran que tiene las posibilidades para poder cubrir la cancelación del crédito sin dificultades.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a shopkeeper, selling groceries, soft drinks and canned goods. She is 65 years old and has been in business for 25. Her husband is 83 years old and her three children are married and living independently and do not help her so she must tend the shop to make a living. Her home and shop are in the same building in the Obispo Indaburo neighborhood in La Paz. It is a neighborhood grocery store so she sells every day. She has been an IMPRO client since September of 2004 with a first-class repayment record, which along with her experience recommends her for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

Francisca es comerciante, tiene una tienda donde vende abarrotes, refrescos y conservas. Tiene 65 años y tres hijos, su experiencia en el rubro es mas de 25 años, su esposo tiene 83 años por lo que el único ingreso que tiene se origina en la tienda ya que sus hijos son casados e independientes y no le ayudan por lo cual la señora tiene que atender su tienda para solventar sus gastos familiares. Vive en la zona de Obispo Indaburo de la ciudad de La Paz, y su tienda se encuentra ubicada en el mismo domicilio. Sus ventas son diarias ya que como es una tienda de barrio los productos que vende son al detalle. Es cliente de Impro, desde septiembre del año 2004. Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento Muy Bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de abarrotes, refrescos y conservas. Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio.

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Early payoff.  Francisca is applying for another loan.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan will be used to purchase used clothes and to pay suppliers for new clothes and accesories.

loans.name: Blanca R.

texts.en:
Blanca sells dresses, perfume and cosmetics door to door, mostly in offices. She is 45 years old and has two university-aged daughters. She doesn't have a shop, but is what in Bolivia is called a "runner". She sells on credit, showing customers pictures of the goods in magazines or catalogs and delivering them the same day, or at least within 24 hours, then collecting her own pay every fifteen days. This is the third loan she has taken out through IMPRO and she has a first-class record of repayment. This loan will pay for her daughters' university education because she is the only earner in the family. She is eligible for this loan on the strength of her work and credit history, and she will be able to repay it.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

Blanca vende trajes, perfumes y cosméticos, repartiendo en las oficinas. No tiene un puesto fijo ya que es promotora lo que en Bolivia comúnmente lo denominamos corredoras. Tiene 45 años y dos hijas en edad universitaria. Sus ventas son al crédito ya que trabaja solo con muestras en revistas y ella les entrega el mismo día o máximo después de las 24 hrs.realizando las cobranzas cada 15 días. Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento muy bueno de pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para el pago de los gastos de educación universitaria de sus hijas ya que la señora es separada y es la única que solventa los gastos de su familia. Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio, el cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: To pay for her children's education.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David lives in his own home on Manuel Caceres Street in the Tembladerani neighborhood in La Paz. He is 52 years old and is separated from his wife. He has three daughters of which the youngest lives with him. David is a tailor and in the morning he makes heavy shirts, parkas and backpacks as ordered by retailers. At night he works for a radio taxi service. This loan will let him buy fabric in bulk so he wastes less, makes better goods and saves money over the way he does things now, which is to buy in small quantities, hurting his business. He has been an IMPRO client since 2004 and is considered a good client, eligible for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

David vive en casa propia en la calle Manuel Cáceres de la zona de Tembladerani de la Ciudad de La Paz, tiene 52 años de edad, esta separado de la esposa y tiene tres hijas de las cuales la menor vive con el desde hace doce años. David es tallerista y por las mañanas se dedica a la confección de chamarras, parcas, mochilas a pedido de comerciantes minoristas de ropa. Mientras que por las noches trabaja en el servicio de radio taxi; el crédito que esta solicitando es para comprar materia prima en mayor cantidad porque así optimiza su utilización y mejora su nivel de utilidad, ya que a la fecha compra sus insumos en cantidad limitada, lo que le resulta perjudicial en su negocio. Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2004 , y tiene calificación de buen cliente, por lo cual se considera sujeto de crédito.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.en:
Maria Victoria B. has 3 children, whom she raises along with her spouse, Roberto Ovidio Sánchez. Maria runs her own dressmaking business at her workshop in San Pedro de Macorís. She has been working hard to expand her business to support her family.

She received and successfully paid off a previous loan from Esperanza and is now eligible for this new loan of $600. She will use this loan to purchase more material as well as sewing equipment and spare parts to increase productivity. Maria says her goal is to make the clothing that she sells better every time.

loans.use: Purchase fabric and equipment to expand her workshop and increase production

loans.name: Rocio

texts.en:
Rocio has a two-month-old son. Her husband works in Cochabamba as a member of the Bolivian Police force, at the lowest-ranked and lowest-paid level. Rocio sells hen's eggs throughout La Paz and rents a home there in a neighborhood called Munaypata. This loan will help her increase her stock to satisfy market demand. This is her first loan with IMPRO and our evaluation favors extending her credit to increase her revenues and help her family.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

Rocío tiene un hijo de 2 meses, el esposo trabaja en la ciudad de Cochabamba y es miembro de base de la Policía Boliviana. (el menor rango con menor ingreso) Rocío es comerciante de huevos de gallina en toda la ciudad de La Paz, vive en alquiler en zona de Munaypata de esta ciudad El crédito lo destinara para aumentar su mercadería de esa forma satisfacer la cantidad de demanda que tiene en la actualidad en el mercado donde trabaja. Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada le permite acceder a un préstamo, de esa forma ayudarle para el crecimiento de su negocio y generar mayores ingresos para su familia.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is an assistant at a small business that makes children's clothing in La Paz. She has two children, 7 and 12 years of age. She lives in an "anticretico" room in the 16th of July neighborhood in El Alto [Translator's Note: An "anticretico" is a special rental arrangement offered in Bolivia. See: http://www.escapeartist.com/OREQ3/Rent_Free_Bolivia.html] This loan will let her buy an Overloock sewing machine so she can work on her own,increasing her income for the benefit for her family. This is her first loan with IMPRO. Her sewing experience qualifies her for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

Celia es ayudante de costura de ropa para niños en una pequeña microempresa en la ciudad de La Paz.Tiene dos hijos de 12 y 7 años y vive en una habitación en anticretico ubicada en la zona 16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto. El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una Maquina de coser Overloock, para poder trabajar por cuenta propio y poder incrementar sus ingresos económicos para la mejor manutención de su familia. Es el primer crédito con Impro; la experiencia que tiene como costurera le faculta para aprobarle el préstamo.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She wants the money to invest in the maintenance and repair of her cafeteria. Another portion of the money will go to invest in an industrial stove, which will allow her to prepare better meals, quicker and easier.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She will use the loan to purchase inventory to stock her bookstore and for the repair and maintenance of the photocopy machines, which are more than 10 years old.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina S. is raising her only son. She has been a successful entrepreneur since 1998, when she applied for her first loan of $150. She used that loan to buy bread, which she sold in the street. Today she has three businesses selling clothing, bedding, and general household items.

Cristina has appied for this loan of $600, her fourth loan overall, to start her general store and increase her investment in her other businesses. She is very dedicated to her work and to teaching her son good values. She has become an example for other entrepreneurs in her community to follow.

loans.use: Purchase inventory for new general store and two other small businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She will invest her load in the construction of a foodstand and for the purchase of products to prepare and sell Vigorón, a traditional Nicaraguan dish.

loans.name: Joaquín

texts.en:
Joaquín D. L. S. is a single father with two children. He provides for his family by running a small business in car parts. He sells spare parts and repairs and replaces motors in the city of San Pedro D. Macorís.

Joaquín has requested this special loan of $750 to replenish and expand his inventory of equipment most requested by his clients. The parts are expensive, but the profit margin is large. His long-term goal is to save enough money to send his two children to college.

loans.use: Purchase engine fuel and replacement parts for automobiles

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Mrs. Martina has had her business for one and a half years. My salon is across from a school, so many people pass by. My problem is that I don't have accessories for hairstyling - dyes and bases, as well as a hairstyling chair. I am requesting $1000 to buy hairdressing accessories and a chair.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer

La Sra. Martina tiene su negocio desde hace 1 año y medio. Mi estética está enfrente de una escuela así es que pasa mucha gente por ahí, mi problema es que me hacen falta accesorios para hacer los cortes de cabello, los tintes y las bases así como también un sillón para estética". Solicito $ 1000.00 dlls para comprar accesorios para la estética y un sillón.

loans.use: Invest in the business and buy a chair

loans.name: Jusdy Nelly

texts.en:
Jusdy is married with two small children. Her husband is a carpenter. His income depends on the amount of work he is able to obtain as he has no fixed salary. Faced with this situation, Judy saw the need to earn an extra income to allow her to cover the household debts. For the past four years, she has been in the business of selling clothing. She started selling only children’s and women’s clothes, but as the business began to do well she expanded into the sale of shoes and clothes for the whole family.

Jusdy is now seeking a loan of $250 to obtain the merchandise needed to offer a greater selection of products and meet the demands of her customers. She is offering to repay the loan over a period of 3 to 6 months. You can be a fundamental part of the growth of this business. Don’t hesitate any longer and support Jusdy.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Jusdy es casada y tiene dos pequeños hijos, su esposo es carpintero, y el ingreso que obtiene depende del trabajo que pueda conseguir, porque no tiene un trabajo fijo. Ante esta situación, Jusdy se vio en la necesidad de obtener u ingreso extra que le permitiera cubrir las deudas de su hogar, desde hace cuatro años se dedica a la venta de ropa, inició sólo con ropa de niños y dama, pero como obtuvo buenos resultados fue incorporando la venta de zapatos y ropa para toda la familia.

Ahora Jusdy necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 250 dólares con lo que obtendrá mercancía para tener una mayor variedad de productos y cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, ella ofrece devolver este crédito en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses. Tú puedes ser parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyar a Jusdy.

loans.use: Acquire merchandise

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mr.Sok C., 25 years old,lives with his wife in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He makes his living by driving a moto-taxi and typically makes revenue of $4 per day. His wife (who appears in this photo), meanwhile, is self-employed as a garment worker and contributes all her wages to the household.

C. hopes that the loan will allows him to purchase a motorcycle for running his business and repair his house to prevent leaking in the coming rainy season. In the future, if he saves enough money, he would like to build a reasonable house for his family and send his children to the local university.

loans.use: To buy a moto-taxi in order to generate income

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en:
Mrs Sreng C., 37 years old , is a widow living with 9 children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is struggling to feed all her children by selling fruits at the nearby market. Usually, she earns an average of $4 a day. Three of her children work at the local garment factory and contribute their salary to the household. Two others are ordained and stay with the monks at the pagoda near this village, and they are students as well.

C. hopes to use the loan to purchase a variety of fruits to run her business, and to fix her current house. In the future, she thinks about being able to expand her business and build a suitable concrete house for her family. One more hope, if she saves enough money, is to send her children to the local university.

loans.use: To buy more fruits to run her business.

payments.comment:
Dear Kiva Lender,

Great news! Sreng Chantha has repaid the Kiva loan early! Kiva and CREDIT MFI make every effort to be as transparent as possible so you can trust the information we give you. In this case, we didn’t let you know that the loan had been repaid at the time. Occasionally, when a loan is repaid early, the payment schedule posted on Kiva doesn’t always match the records of our micro finance partner in Cambodia, CREDIT MFI. As in life, the system doesn’t always run perfectly, but when there is a discrepancy we will alert you as soon as possible so you have all the information about your investment.

On the upside, the issue occurred because the client’s business is so successful! Your loan made that possible. Soon you will see a repayment posted on the client’s profile that is larger than the usual amount. This will end the loan and return the funds to your account. We hope you will choose to loan the repaid funds to another entrepreneur who would a like a chance to grow their business as well. 

If you have any questions, please post them as a comment on this borrowers site and I will be happy to respond. I also encourage you to write comments on the pages of your loan recipients so we can pass along your good wishes to the borrowers.

We sincerely apologize for the oversight and are putting policies in place to make sure that it doesn’t happen again. Thank you for giving poor entrepreneurs in Cambodia a chance at success! 

Best regards,

Sopheap Khiev, Kiva partnership coordinator, Cambodia
Mr. Chan Mach, General Manager, CREDIT MFI, Cambodia

loans.name: Um

texts.en:
Mrs. Um M. D. is 35 years old and a widow living with her son in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She struggles to make her living by owning a clothes-making business with 2 workers. She can typically makes around $6/day from this business. Her child is a student and aids his mother when he is free from class.

D. hopes to use the loan to purchase more cloth and pays her workers' wages. In the future, if she saves enough money, she hopes to purchase two or three sewing machines in order to facilitate her business. If possible, she will build a garment shop and send her son to a university.

loans.use: To purchase more cloth and pay her worker's wage.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock of quality shoes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of quality shoes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of quality shoes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of quality shoes

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Cahul is the largest city in the southern part of Moldova; with 50,000 people it is a great location to start any business.  Local farmers from the surrounding area bring their goods to the local market or to the wholesalers for resale within the city.  The south has rich soil to grow a vast array of crops and is ideal for farmers to grow many different vegetables.  
Elena C. is a mother of two and together with her husband they work on their land which she inherited from her parents. Since she inherited their land she has been working hard to prepare the land to be vibrant enough to grow vegetables for resale.  The land needs a lot of repairs especially the greenhouses, which were erected poorly. She does not have sufficient monetary resources to repair these greenhouses and buy saplings to grow for commercial use.  These greenhouses are a new venture for Elena, she has studied about the benefits of using greenhoueses and is confident on the possiabilities for success. She would like a loan to purchase additional plastic film to cover her greenhouses and seedlings to grow different vegetables to start saplings and then transplant them to her land.

loans.use: To purchase protective plastic for her greenhouse and saplings to start growing vegitables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of quality shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: adding more stock from the main fish market in Kenya

loans.name: Christabel

texts.en: Christabel O. is 65 years old. She is a widow with three children. Two of her children have already cleared their O level education. One of them is still in high school and is due to complete his studies this year. Cristabel sells dry fish and sardines, her business is lucrative and the market where she is located is always streaming with clients. her customer care skills are good and her clients rarely go to other clients to buy the fish after they have bought from her. She wishes to expand her business, by adding more stock, buying the fish products directly from the main fish market in Kenya, and selling the fish to other small retailers in her town. She is requesting for a loan of US$ 900. with which she will buy dried sardines and dried fish for US$700 and she will use US$ 200 for transportation costs.

loans.use: to add more stock of fish from the fish market

loans.name: Agbontaen

texts.en: Agbontaen E. is a young woman who is 43 years of age. She is married with six (6) children and has been an LAPO client for 2 years. She is experienced in her line of business and has proven her worthiness for a loan from LAPO. She will use the money ($550) to keep her business booming.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en: Celestina A. is a young and beautiful woman who is 38 years of age. She is married with two (2) children and has been an LAPO client for 3 years. She is experienced in her line of business and has proven her worthiness of a loan from LAPO. She will use the money ($400) to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more drugs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her business with new stock and a permanent premises

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia I. is a young and beautiful woman who is 54 years of age. She is married with two (2) children and has been an LAPO client for 6 years. She is experienced in her line of business and worthy of a loan from LAPO. She will use the money ($400) to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Fred  W.

texts.en: Fred is married with six children, all in primary school. Though he couldn't afford formal training, he worked hard as a farmer. But he needed more income, so he began a small business to supplement his earnings. He is requesting a loan to buy more stock for his cereals business, which will allow him to better support his family and meet their needs.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Ogbemudia

texts.en: Mrs. Ogbedmudia E. is a 53-year-old woman who is married with five children. She became an LAPO client in 2005 (2 years ago). She started the above business in 2004 in the semi-urban area of Benin City, the state capital of Edo State, Nigeria. According to her, she came to LAPO in 2005 when her business was shaky, and her business improved after working with LAPO. With the loan of $550, she will expand her drinks store to serve a wide range of people in her local community.

loans.use: To buy more crates of drinks

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Mrs. Rose I. is a lovely and faithful mother.  She is 36 years old. She sells drinks and snacks to her community. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She hopes to use the loan for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and baking equipment for snacks for sale

loans.name: Joseph  Isaac

texts.en: Joseph is married with two children, one in primary school and the other still at home. He finished his secondary school successfully and wishes to join college in two years. He started his business in 2005 in order to sustain his family. His business includes buying cereals from farmers and selling them at the local markets during market days. Through his business, he has been able to help his parents pay school fees for his younger brothers. He is requesting a loan from PEMCI so he can increase his cereals stock during this harvest season and improve his income.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her business by buying more stock of tea.

loans.name: Moses Njibwakale

texts.en: Moses started his business in 1990 with capital from the sale of his farm produce. His business includes buying cattle from the nearest markets and selling them at a higher price to farmers or at Slaughter houses. Through his business, he has been able to educate his twelve children up to secondary school levels. With a second loan from PEMCI, he intents to increase on his stock and improve on his market base through moving in the different markets.

loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Mrs. Gladys O. is 45 years old and married with six (6) children. She sells baby clothes for mothers and has no cause to regret it. She says, "My numerous customers always give me satisfaction." She will use the loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Moses Njibwakale

texts.en: Moses started his business in 1990 with capital from sales of his farm produce. His business includes buying cattle from the nearest markets and selling them at a higher price to farmers or at Slaughter houses. Through his business, he has been able to educate his twelve children up to secondary school levels. With a second loan from PEMCI, he will increase his stock and improve his market base by selling in a variety of markets. This will bring him more customers.

loans.use: To increase on his stock

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Mrs. Felicia O. is a 37-year-old woman who sells clothing. She is married with seven (7) children. She lives in Benin City, Nigeria. She hopes to use the loan for business improvement.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Mrs. Patience I. is a 54-year-old woman who is married with three (3) children. She is from the semi-urban area of Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells baby clothes to people in her community. She will use the above loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Folake

texts.en: Mrs. Folake is a woman of great dignity and power who sells provisions to people in her community. Mrs. Folake A. is 30 years old. She is married with four (4) children. She lives in Benin City, Nigeria. She hopes to use the loan for business improvement.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale

loans.name: Ugbo

texts.en: Mrs. Ugbo M. is a 40-year-old woman. She is married with six (6) children. She lives in Benin City, Nigeria. She hopes to use the loan for business improvement.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Sule

texts.en: Mrs. Sule H. is a lovely and faithful mother of two children. She is 29 years old. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells plastics and rubber to the community. She hopes to use the loan for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: "I changed to this business four (4) years ago and I have no cause to regret it. Though I am 42 years old, my numerous customers always give me satisfaction," says Mrs. Judith O.. She needs the above amount to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more wears for sales

loans.name: Victor Amenawon

texts.en: Mr. Victor Amenawon E. is 34 years. He is married with a child. He sells handsets and recharge cards, and he makes call for the public. He hopes to get the above amount to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy goods

loans.name: Hudson Busuru

texts.en:
Hudson is a married man with nine children, all in primary school. He has not undergone formal training, but has apprenticed in radio repair.
He started his business in 2002 after he began earning money by selling second-hand and new clothes on public buses while he was employed as a bus conductor. Now he does radio repair along with selling clothes, and he has trained three boys in radio repair since he started. With loan from PEMCI, he plans to buy radio spares to sell to his clients. He will also buy more stock for his clothes business. By making his radio service available to the local people and providing inexpensive, decent clothes to his customers, he is able to support his family's needs.
