Luz inició su negocio teniendo en mente el poder ofrecer un mejor futuro para sus hijos, en aquél entonces muy pequeños, ella tiene dos hijos de 9 y 17 años, los cuales estudian, el mas pequeño la escuela primaria y su hija la mayor esta cursando la escuela preparatoria.

Actualmente el negocio de Luz requiere de capital de trabajo, pues se descapitalizó en los pasados meses de clima frío, ya que en la ciudad en donde vive el invierno es duro y baja considerablemente la actividad económica. En su negocio ella brinda empleo a tres mujeres, también madres de familia. Requiere de este préstamo por $925 USD para la compra de materias primas y con eso poder surtir los pedidos que le están haciendo sus clientes. El plazo que solicita para pagarlo es de 6-12 meses.

Ella quiere que su negocio siga creciendo para poder apoyar los estudios profesionales de su hija, ya que está próxima a iniciarlos. Sé parte del fortalecimiento de su negocio y apóyala con su préstamo y contribuye así a la educación de su familia.

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia was born in Zacatecas. She is married and has four grown children, the youngest of them 19. Alicia used to work in a department store but her hours didn't give her time with her children and her pay was insufficient so she decided to open her own business buying and selling ceramics. A friend invited her to a ceramics showcase and Alicia decided that this could be a good business for her. Alicia is asking for a loan of $475 to buy a greater variety of merchandise. She says this is a good time of year for selling ceramics because many tourists come to Zacatecas now. She promises to repay this loan in 6 to 12 months and thanks you for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

Alicia nació en Zacatecas, esta casada y tiene cuatro hijos mayores, el menor de ellos tiene 19 años. Alicia ante trabaja en un departamento de compras y su horario de trabajo no le permitía estar con sus hijos y no le daba el ingreso suficiente para poder ayudar en la economía del hogar, por ello Alicia decidió abrir su propio negocio, el cual es la compra y venta de cerámica. Cuando inició fue por la invitación de una amiga que la llevo a una demostración de cerámica y vio que podía ser un buen negocio y se decidió a iniciarlo.

Alicia esta solicitando un préstamo de US $475 para comprar mercancía y tener un mayor surtido en su negocio, ella comenta que esta es una buena época para la venta de cerámica por que van muchos turistas a Zacatecas en esta temporada. Alicia promete pagar este préstamo en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses, y agradece tu ayuda.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Miliana

texts.en:
Miliana is married, and her husband is a miner. Her husband’s pay is low and, thus, she decided to open her own ceramics and plastics business. This was a familiar business since her mother, the person from whom she learned the trade, had worked in the same field. Little by little her business grew and she began to sell various merchandise. This work has allowed her to obtain a better way of life and improve her economic position, providing a future in which she can have a family and supply them with everything they need.

Miliana is seeking a loan for 475 dollars to increase her stock and diversify her merchandise. She intends to pay back this loan within 6-12 months and appreciates your help.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Miliana esta casada y su esposo es minero y como trabajador su sueldo es bajo, por ello es que ella decidió abrir su propio negocio de compra y venta de cerámicos y plástico. Este negocio lo conoció ya que su madre se dedicaba a lo mismo y ella aprendió. Poco a poco su negocio ha ido creciendo y comenzó a vender otras mercancías en su negocio. Este trabajo les ha permitido obtener una mejor calidad de vida y poder mejorar cada vez económicamente para así en un futuro poder tener una familia y brindarles todo lo que ellos necesiten en su momento.

Miliana esta solicitando un préstamo por US$ 475 para incrementar su inventario y tener mayor mercancía que vender a sus clientes ofreciendo pagar este préstamo en un tiempo de 6 a 12 meses y les agradece su ayuda.

loans.use: To increase and diversify stock

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is originally from Nicaragua, but he is now a nationalized Mexican citizen. He is married and has two children, ages 10 and 14. He started in the shoe business 12 years ago, as an aprentice. Then he got married and started a business out of his own home. He started his own business because he wanted to be self employed and he wanted to spend more time with his family. After working out of his home, his business grew and he rented a storefront.

Rogelio is asking for a $375 loan which he will use to buy materials for shoe repair. He wants to buy in bulk, to lower his costs and he hopes you will help. He plans to pay back this loan in 6 to 12 months.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Rogelio, es originario de Nicaragua, ahora ya esta nacionalizado Mexicano, esta casado y tiene dos hijos, una de 10 años y el otro de 14 años. Inicio en su negocio hace 12 años, aprendiendo primero cuando llego a México como aprendiz en un taller y luego se caso y en su propia casa él apertura un taller de reparaciones de zapatos. El se decidió a tener este negocio por que no quería trabajar para terceros y por que deseaba pasar más tiempo con su familia. Luego de empezar en su hogar, su trabajo fue mejorando y obteniendo más clientes, por ello con el tiempo se mudo a otro local el cual lo renta.

Rogelio esta solicitando un préstamo por US$ 375 para comprar insumos para hacer las reparaciones y quiere aprovechar la compra al por mayor para que sus costos sean menores que comprar al detalle, espera de tu ayuda y ofrece pagar este crédito en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses.

loans.use: To buy shoe repair materials

loans.name: Armanda

texts.en:
Armanda is married and lives in Zacatecas. She has two daughters, ages 15 and 6. Her husband works as a laborer in a food packing business in the city. She began her beauty services business to help with the family expenses. She began by cutting hair in the living room of her home, but little by little word spread and she began to have more clients, which allowed her to rent a storefront for her business.

Armanda is asking for a $475 loan which she plans to repay in 6 to 12 months. She will use the loan to save money on materials by buying in bulk. She looks forward to your support in helping her business grow.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Armanda, es una mujer casada y vive en Zacatecas, tiene dos hijas, una de 15 años y la otra más pequeña de 6 años. Su esposo trabaja como obrero en una empresa empacadora de alimentos en esa ciudad. Inicio con su negocio de estética para poder ayudar con el gasto familiar, inicialmente empezó cortando el cabello en la sala de su casa y poco a poco se fue dando a conocer y empezó a tener más clientes, lo que la ayudo a poder rentar un local exclusivo para su negocio.

Armanda esta solicitando un crédito por US $475 que ofrece en pagar en un tiempo de 6 a 12 meses, este préstamo lo utilizará para comprar materiales al por mayor y aprovechar un mejor precio de los mismos, espera tu colaboración para continuar creciendo con su negocio.

loans.use: To buy materials in bulk

loans.name: Nora Alicia

texts.en:
Nora is married with 3 children, ages 13, 11, and 4. Her husband is a a contract laborer, and his wages are low and variable. Given the costs of childcare, Nora needed a business that allowed her to stay home with her children. This situation motivated her to begin selling lingerie/undergarments by catalog 8 years ago. Little by little word spread and she introduced new products such as shoes and cosmetics, also by catalog.

Nora is asking for $550 loan to have an inventory of merchandise to sell directly, rather than by catalog. This way, her clients won't have to wait for the delivery of their purchases. She plans to pay back the loan in 6-12 months. She looks forward to your support to help her business grow.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Nora esta casada y tiene 3 hijos de 13 años la mayor y 11 y 4 los dos hijos menores, su esposo es trabajador independiente comisionista y sus ingresos son pocos y variables, que fue el motivo que hizo que Nora trabaje en el negocio que inicio hace 8 años vendiendo ropa interior por catálogo y poco a poco fue creciendo con su negocio y entro en la venta de zapatos y cosméticos, también por catálogo, otra de las razones para empezar con su negocio fue que no buscaba empleo por que no tenia con quien dejar a los hijos por lo tanto era solo un pequeño ingreso en su hogar y de esta manera ella puede estar en su hogar y ver a sus hijos.

Nora esta solicitando un préstamo por US$ 550 para comprar mercancía en existencia y hacer una venta directa y en el momento para que sus clientes no tengan que esperar a que realice el pedido y esperar mientras llega el mismo, ofrece pagar el préstamo en un tiempo de 6 a 12 meses y espera de tu apoyo para continuar creciendo.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo is married and his wife works at home, caring for their 4 children, ages 23, 17, 15 and 8. He started his business 15 years ago when he was unemployed, but of course he still had to provide for his family. At the time, a friend transferred his business to Domingo, and little by little, he began cultivating his own clients. He works in his shop with his 15 year old son.

Domingo is asking for a $475 loan to buy materials for his tire business, as well as merchandise like tires, tire chambers, valves, etc. that will allow him to offer better service and grow his business. He plans to repay this loan in 6-12 months. He looks forward to your support in helping his family obtain a better quality of life.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Domingo esta casado y su esposa no trabaja, ella se dedica al hogar y a sus hijos que son cuatro, tres hombres de 23, 17 y 15 años respectivamente y una mujercita de 8 años. Empezó con el negocio hace 15 años cuando se quedo sin trabajo, y tenía la necesidad de mantener a su familia, fue en ese entonces que un amigo de él le traspaso el negocio para que se haga cargo y poco a poco se fue haciendo de sus propios clientes, en el taller trabaja con el su hijo de 15 años de edad.

Domingo esta solicitando un préstamo por US$ 475 para comprar materiales de trabajo y también mercancía para vender como llantas, cámaras de llanta, válvulas, etc. que le permitirá dar un mejor servicio y crecer en el negocio, ofrece pagar el crédito en un período de 6 a 12 meses y cuenta con tu ayuda para sacar adelante a su familia y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.en:
Marco is originally from Zacatecas. He is married with 3 children, ages 11, 9, and 3. His wife works at home, caring for their children. He began his business 9 years ago. At the time he was unemployed, but he had a wife and a son to support, and another child on the way. So he and his wife decided to start a bakery in their home. The business has grown and earned a reputation in the neighborhood. Their son occasionally helps out in the family business.

Marco is asking for a $375 loan to buy raw materials. This will help increase production and sales. He hopes to sell his baked goods at other outlets, and thereby grow his business. He plans to repay the loan in 6-12 months. He looks forward to your support and he and his family thank you.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Marco es originario de Zacatecas, esta casado y tiene tres hijos de 11, 9 y 3 años respectivamente, su esposa no trabaja y se dedica a su hogar y al cuidado de los hijos. Inicio su negocio hace nueve años, ya que estando casado no conseguía empleo y con un hijo y una esposa que mantener, sumándole un segundo hijo en camino, junto con su esposa decidieron dedicarse a la repostería en su hogar y ofrecer sus productos a las personas. Actualmente el negocio ha ido creciendo y se ha hecho conocido, por ello en ocasiones lo ayuda su hijo mayor.

Esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 325 para comprar materia prima, lo que le permitirá incrementar su producción, y podrá tener mayores ventas, ya que su idea es vender a otras tiendas a comisión y así seguir creciendo con su negocio, ofrece pagar este crédito en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses y cuenta con el apoyo de todos ustedes y junto con su familia se los agradece.

loans.use: To buy raw materials.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena is married with 3 children, ages 20, 18, and 15. Her husband is a laborer and his salary varies because there are periods when there is no work for him. For this reason, 5 years ago, Maria Elena began to look for options to bring more income into the home. A friend invited her to sell products by catalog. She began selling shoes, but later as her client base grew, she included cosmetics by catalog as well.

Maria Elena is asking for a $550 loan to buy products to have on hand, and thereby offer products directly to her clients, without having them wait for delivery. She plans to repay this loan in 6-12 months. She looks forward to your support in helping her reach her goals and grow her business.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

María Elena es una mujer casada y tiene tres hijos hombres de 20, 18 y 15 años de edad respectivamente, su esposo trabaja como albañil y su sueldo es muy variable por que hay épocas en las que no hay obras y por lo tanto no tiene trabajo, por ello hace cinco años María Elena por la necesidad empezó a ver las opciones de cómo aportar en algo con la economía familiar y por invitación de una amiga empezó a vender productos por catálogo, empezó vendiendo zapatos y posteriormente también incremento su cartera de clientes y empezó a vender cosméticos de la misma forma.

María Elena solicita un préstamos de US $ 550 para comprar mercancía y tener en existencia para así poder ofrecer sus productos de una manera más rápida y tener contentos a sus clientes sin hacerlos esperar mientras llegan sus productos, ella ofrece pagar este préstamo en un tiempo de 6 a 12 meses y espera la ayuden a lograr sus metas y crecer con su negocio.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is a married woman and the mother of four children. Her husband is retired and the pension they receive is not enough to cover all of their family expenses and so she decided to open a small store. As she didn't have the capital to start her store with, she asked the help of Coca Cola who loaned her a small lot where she began to sell small items, however, her business has grown with time. Today, the whole family works in the store and Carolina wishes to expand even more as she is very much an entrepeneur.

She is asking for a loan of $250.00 in order to buy stationary and to expand her store by offering this new product which, from her experience, she will see high demands for from her customers since they themselves have asked her for it. She proposes to pay the loan in 3-6 months and she awaits your colaboration in order to see her dreams realized and to see her family and business grow at the same time.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Carolina es una mujer casada y tiene cuatro hijos, su esposo es una persona pensionada, y la pensión que recibe no era suficiente para poder cubrir los gastos del hogar por lo que ella decidió abrir una pequeña tienda, al no tener el capital para empezar, recurrió a la ayuda de la Coca Cola que en ese entonces le presto un pequeño puestito en el cual ella empezó vendiendo muy pocas cosas, pero con el tiempo fue mejorando su negocio y lo amplió, actualmente toda la familia atiende en el negocio y Carolina quiere ampliarlo aún más, es una mujer muy emprendedora.

Ella esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 250 para poder comprar papelería y ampliar su tienda ofreciendo estos productos que según su experiencia va a tener mucha demanda de sus clientes ya que ellos mismos se lo han solicitado, ofrece pagar este préstamo en un período de 3 a 6 meses y espera tu colaboración en sus deseos de superarse y crecer junto con su familia y negocio.

loans.use: To supply the store.

loans.name: Magda Concepción

texts.en:
Magda is married and has three children--two boys ages 9 and 13 and a 7-year-old girl. Her husband works for the Mexican Social Security Institute. Magda has been sewing for 14 years and has always enjoyed it. In the beginning, she only sewed for her own family. When her children started school 7 years ago she sewed their uniforms, and in time others began asking her to do some tailoring for them and she became known and made a business out of it, hoping to finance a good education for her children. Magda is asking for a $250 loan to stock up on cloth. So far she has only done sewing but now she would like to expand her business and offer cloth for sale. She plans to repay the loan in 3 to 6 months and thanks you in advance for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

Magda esta casada y tiene 3 hijos pequeños dos hombres de 13 y 9 años de edad respectivamente y una mujercita de 7 años. Su esposo es trabajador en el IMSS, que es el Instituto Mexicano del Seguro Social. Magda siempre a tenido gusto por la costura y se dedica a esto hace 14 años pero solamente cocía para su familia, ya cuando sus hijos empezaron la escuela hace siete años atrás, ella les confeccionaba sus uniformes, con el tiempo algunas personas les solicitaron algunos trabajos de costura y así poco a poco se hizo conocida y continuó con el negocio, con este negocio ella desea pagarle una buena educación a sus hijos.

Magda esta solicitando un préstamo de US $ 250 para comprar telas, ya que ella solo confecciona y cose, ahora ella desea también ofrecer las telas a sus clientes y así continuar creciendo, ofrece pagar el préstamo en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses y cuenta con la ayuda que ustedes le pueden brindar, por ello les agradece por adelantado su colaboración.

loans.use: To buy cloth.

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.en:
Maria de Lourdes is considered en enterprising, hard working and independent woman. She is 46 years old and is not married. She began her business because she lost her job working in a factory in Tampico and she lives with her parents and as they are elderly, she cares for them. However, she needs an income that will allow her to support them and herself, which is why with what little money she could save, she began her business in 2002. Little by little she has seen her business grow and at the same time, it permits her to have sufficient time to care for her parents. She works in a stationary store and she is always ready for customers and to treat them well so that they return and make recommendations to friends.

Maria is asking for a loan of $1,100 in order to buy a copier as the one she had previously has fallen into disrepair and also to buy merchandise in order to have a wider variety of stock avaiable to clients. She proposes to repay the loan in 5-10 months and with your help she can improve and continue seeing her business grow.

Translated by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

María de Lourdes se considera una persona emprendedora, trabajadora e independiente, tiene 46 años de edad y no esta casada. Empezó con su negocio por que dejo de trabajar como empleada en una empresa en Tampico, y ella vive con sus padres y como ya son personas mayores ella se hizo cargo de ellos, por ello necesitaba de un ingreso que les permita mantenerlos y a ella también, así que inicialmente con un pequeño capital que pudo ahorrar empezó con su negocio en el 2002 y poco a poco este negocio ha comenzado a crecer y a la vez le da tiempo de poder estar al cuidado de sus padres, se decidió por abrir una papelería y esta siempre pendiente de los clientes y sus necesidades para mantenerlos y que se incrementen.

María esta solicitando un préstamo de US $ 1,100 para comprar una copiadora ya que la que tenía anteriormente se malogro y también para comprar mercancías para tener un mayor surtido de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes, ofrece pagar el préstamo en un período de 5 a 10 meses y con tu ayuda ella podrá mejorar y continuar creciendo con su negocio.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Imelda

texts.en:
Maris Imelda has three children, though her husband left her but it was because of this that she decided to open her own store. She used to work in a hotel and her salary was not enough to support her home, because once she was left on her own, she was responsible for providing for the whole family. She began her business 25 years ago, selling her merchandise to co-workers and to friends. She sold beauty products of a well known Mexican brand, however, with the passing of time, other and better brands appeared on the market and today she actually sells another brand that has a high demand from her customers. She is a good saleswoman and she very much likes what she does for a living.

Today, she is asking for a loan of $925 in order to cover the requests she has from customers, who already pay on credit, which is hard on her because she has many requests and to comply with them all she needs money to buy the merchandise to keep her customers happy and satisfied. She proposes to repay the loan in 6-12 months and she thanks you very much for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

María Imelda tiene tres hijos, su esposo los abandono y fue por ello que se decidió a abrir su propio negocio, ella trabajaba como empleada en un Motel y su sueldo no le alcanzaba para la manutención del hogar, por que al quedarse sola, tuvo que ver por toda su familia, empezó con su negocio hace 25 años vendiendo sus productos entre compañeros de trabajo y amigos, vendía productos de belleza de una marca reconocida en México, pero con el paso del tiempo salieron mejores por lo que ella también evolucionó como el mercado lo solicitaba y actualmente vende otra marca que es muy solicitada por sus clientes. Ella es una buena vendedora y sobre todo e gusta lo que hace.

Actualmente esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 925 para poder cubrir los pedidos que tiene con sus clientes, los cuales ya los tiene avanzados por que tiene muchos pedidos por delante por ello con este dinero podrá satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes y tenerlos contentos, ofrece pagar este préstamo en un período de 6 a 12 meses y les agradece su apoyo.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Martha Imelda

texts.en:
Martha is 53 years old, single, honest, hard working and helpful. She began her business because after she retired, she was left to care for her elderly mother who is ill, which results in high costs for medicines and also maintaining her home which added up to be more than the pension she received. And so, she decided to open a business so that she could make higher earnings and would be able to support her family. A friend at her former job invited her to buy clothing in the USA and to resell it in Mexico through which she could earn a little to allow her to continue with her business. She sold her merchandise to co-workers, friends and little by little her customers began to grow and now she travels to the city of Moroleon in order to buy her merchandise and resell it to her customers.

Martha is asking for a loan of $925 which will allow her to travel to Moroloen and to buy merchandise, such as clothing and seasonal shoes to satisfy her customers' demands and to have a better variety in stock. She proposes to repay the loan in 6-12 months. She awaits your help which she can appreciate as it will allow her to continue to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Martha es una mujer de 53 años de edad, soltera, honesta, trabajadora y servicial, empezó con su negocio por que luego de jubilarse de su empleo anterior ella quedo a cargo de su madre quien es una persona mayor y está enferma, por lo que el costo de las medicinas y de la manutención de su hogar era mucho más alto a los ingresos que percibe como jubilada, por ello decidió emprender un negocio que le de mayores ingresos y pueda sostener a su familia. Una amiga de su anterior empleo la invitó a comprar ropa de USA y venderla en México y con esto ella pudo hacerse de un pequeño capital que le permitió continuar con el negocio, vendía a sus compañeras del trabajo y amigos y poco a poco sus clientes fueron creciendo y ahora ella viaja a la ciudad de Moroleón para comprar sus mercancías y ofrecer a sus clientes.

Martha esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 925 para poder viajar a Moroleón y comprar mercancía como ropa y calzado de temporada, para poder satisfacer a sus clientes y tener un mayor inventario, ofreciendo pagar este préstamo en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Espera la ayuda que le puedes brindar para que pueda continuar creciendo con su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Del Refugio

texts.en:
Maria del Refugio is divorced and has three children, of whom, 2 are already married and the youngest is 22 and is still at college. The youngest helps her in her store in the afternoons when he is free and Maria also lives with one of her married children and her grandchild and helps provide for them all. Five years ago, she began her business and since then has been the head of the house. Little by little her business has grown and she is very happy with the progress. Maria is a hard working woman, she works in her store every day from Monday to Sunday and she does so willingly as she can see her business growing and can help her family.

Maria is asking for a loan of $475 in order to buy merchandise and to buy new products such as small gifts and stuffed animals. She proposes to repay the loan in 6-12 months and hopes that the support will help her to see her business to continue to grow and to obtain a better quality of life. She and her family thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

María del Refugio esta divorciada y tiene tres hijos, de los cuales 2 ya están casados y el menor tiene 22 años y está en la universidad, este último la ayuda en su negocio por las tardes cuando tiene libre y además ella vive con uno de sus hijos casados y su nieto y ve por ambos económicamente. Hace cinco años empezó con su negocio rentando un lugar en el centro de la ciudad y desde entonces ella ve por su familia, poco a poco su negocio ha ido progresando y esta muy contenta con ello, María es una mujer muy trabajadora, atiende su negocio todos los días de la semana de lunes a domingo y lo hace con mucho gusto por que esta creciendo y así ayuda a su familia.

María del Refugio esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 475 para la compra de mercancía y compra de nuevos productos como regalos y no solo mantenerse en peluches, ella ofrece pagar este préstamo en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses y espera que la apoyes a seguir creciendo con su negocio y obtener una mejor calidad de vida. Ella y su familia te lo agradecen.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.en:
Herlinda is married and has two children in school. Her husband works as an employee in a business. His income didn't cover the children's food and education so she decided to start her own business selling clothing. At first she sold to friends and neighbors, then through referrals her client list grew and now there is good demand for what she sells. She is asking for a loan of $375 to buy merchandise because right now she doesn't have enough stock. She proposes to repay the loan in 6 to 12 months and counts on your support to continue to grow her business and support her children's education.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

Herlinda es una mujer casada y tiene dos hijos quienes se encuentran estudiando, su esposo trabaja como empleado en una empresa. Ella empezó con el negocio por que con el sueldo de su esposo no les alcanzaba para la alimentación y educación de sus hijos, por ello decidió ponerse a vender ropa, inicialmente ofrecía a sus amigas y vecinos y poco a poco fue obteniendo más clientes por recomendación, ahora su cartera de clientes a mejorado mucho y tiene bastantes pedidos de lo que ofrece.

Esta solicitando un crédito de US $ 325 para comprar más mercancía, ya que con el inventario que tiene no le alcanza para surtir a sus clientes y ya a la fecha tiene muchos pedidos que tiene que cumplir, ofrece pagar este crédito en un período de 6 a 12 meses y espera tu colaboración y apoyo para continuar creciendo y educando a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Seng S. is 40 years old living with her husband and 4 children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She works at the local garment factory and typically makes around $3 per day. Her husband, meanwhile, is self-employed as a construction worker and generates about $8/day. Moreover, one of her daughters works at the garment factory and one son (pictured here because his parents were unavailable) is a construction worker and they all contribute their wages to the household. Also, two are students and help to cook meals for their family when they leave school. With the loan, S. hopes to use it to repair her house from leaking in the rainy season. In the future, her husband wants to be a construction foreman and if he saves enough money, he would like to open a hardware stand and send his children to a local university.

loans.use: To repair house in order to protect it in the rainy season.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch S. is 56 years old and lives with her three children and her nephew in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  S.'s husband passed away, so she must support the family herself.  S. works as a tailor and can generate about $3.50 on the average day.  She hopes to use this loan to expand her garment business by purchasing mobile phones so that she can more easily coordinate with her clients.  Additionally, S. hopes to open a stall in the local market to increase her business activity. In the future, she would like to build a concrete house for her family.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones to help expand business

payments.comment:
Dear Kiva Lender,

Great news! Touch Sina has repaid the Kiva loan early! Kiva and CREDIT MFI make every effort to be as transparent as possible so you can trust the information we give you. In this case, we didn’t let you know that the loan had been repaid at the time. Occasionally, when a loan is repaid early, the payment schedule posted on Kiva doesn’t always match the records of our micro finance partner in Cambodia, CREDIT MFI. As in life, the system doesn’t always run perfectly, but when there is a discrepancy we will alert you as soon as possible so you have all the information about your investment.

On the upside, the issue occurred because the client’s business is so successful! Your loan made that possible. Soon you will see a repayment posted on the client’s profile that is larger than the usual amount. This will end the loan and return the funds to your account. We hope you will choose to loan the repaid funds to another entrepreneur who would a like a chance to grow their business as well. 

If you have any questions, please post them as a comment on this borrowers site and I will be happy to respond. I also encourage you to write comments on the pages of your loan recipients so we can pass along your good wishes to the borrowers.

We sincerely apologize for the oversight and are putting policies in place to make sure that it doesn’t happen again. Thank you for giving poor entrepreneurs in Cambodia a chance at success! 

Best regards,

Sopheap Khiev, Kiva partnership coordinator, Cambodia
Mr. Chan Mach, General Manager, CREDIT MFI, Cambodia

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao P. is 54 years old and lives with her husband, six children, and two nephews in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Mao P. rents equipment to families for ceremonies. For example, if a family in their village is having a wedding ceremony, Mao P. will rent the family the necessary equipment, such as tables, chairs, decorations, and speakers. This business usually generates about $7.00 per day. To complement her business, her husband bakes wedding cakes and makes about $12.00 per day (not including costs). With this loan, Mao P. hopes to purchase more chairs and tables to rent to people for ceremonies. In the future, she hopes to send her children to university.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for ceremonies (weddings and funerals)

payments.comment: Congratulation… This family has successfully expanded their business. Thank for a loan this couple has raised the daily income and makes the family have a good living condition. So in the result, they have ability to pay the loan earlier. They thank for generosity.

loans.name: San

texts.en: San S. is 45 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  S. has an unusual business purchasing second-hand pillowcases, then re-selling them to people at the local market. Her business generates about $5.00 of revenue a day. Her husband works for a small private company and can contribute about $2.50 per day to the family's income. Two of her children also work at a private company, and the other two are still students. With this loan, S. hopes to expand her business by purchasing more second-hand pillowcases. In the future, S. hopes that she will be able to send her children to university.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing more pillowcases

loans.name: Seang

texts.en: Seang R. is 49 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  R. is a tailor and can usually make about $3.50 per day. Her husband sells soy bean juice and can make about $8.00 per day. Three of the couple's four children are still students, while the other one works in Thailand. They hope to use this loan to purchase a cart to help R.'s husband sell more soy bean juice. He will use the cart to help carry his soy bean juice around the village. In the future, the couple hopes to have enough money to repair their house and to send their children to university.

loans.use: To purchase a cart to sell soy bean juice

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long N. lives with her husband and five children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  N. works as a mango seller in the local market and can make about $8.00 per day. One of her children helps her to run her mango business, while two are still students.  Another child works as a garment worker and the last child is a security guard. With this loan, the family would like to purchase a motorbike for the family's transportation. Additionally, N. hopes to use part of this loan to purchase more mangoes, thereby expanding her business. In the future, Saiky hopes to expand her business to include many types of fruit. Also, she hopes that her children will be able to learn to read and write in another language.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and to buy more mangoes in order to expand business

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en: Nhem V. lives with her husband and three children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  Her husband (pictured here) is a motorcycle taxi driver and can make about $4.00 per day. Two of the couple's daughters work at a local restaurant, while their son works in Thailand. V. is currently unemployed, but she has an idea to expand the family's house in order to use it as a rental property. To do this, she is requesting a $1000 loan. She will use this loan to repair the house and also to add new rooms.  Eventually, V. hopes that she will be able to build a second house, which she would use exclusively as a rental property.

loans.use: To repair and expand house in order to rent out rooms

loans.name: Ang

texts.en: Ang V. is 40 years old and lives with her 5 children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  Unfortunately, her husband passed away and V. must support the family herself. To do so, she sells traditional Khmer cakes in her village. This business generates a profit of about $1.50 per day. Two of her children help contribute to the family by working in a local garment factory, while the other three children are still in school. V. hopes to use this loan to help construct a small house for her family, as they currently live in a tiny cottage with a poorly constructed roof--with not nearly enough support to keep the house from leaking during the rainy season.  It is V.'s dream that her children will be able to finish high school.

loans.use: To build a house for the family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Helen would like to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business by renting a more spacious premise to accommodate all her clients and to purchase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his business by buying more stock and renovating it.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase inventory levels for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To open a shop from where he can sell products
